mitigation_taken: ['A woman journalist filed a complaint with the Delhi Police requesting an investigation and action.', 'Priyanka Chaturvedi communicated with the Mumbai Police Commissioner and the Deputy Commissioner of Police (Crime) and requested that they investigate the matter.', 'Priyanka Chaturvedi appealed to the Maharashtra Director General of Police to intervene in the case.', 'Asaduddin Owaisi publicly condemned the incident and called for strict action against the accused.', 'Mumbai Police stated that they have taken cognizance of the matter.', 'Mumbai Police instructed the concerned officers to take action.', 'Delhi Police said they have taken cognizance of the matter.', 'Delhi Police assured that they will take strict action.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Supreme Court-appointed technical committee issued a public notice asking citizens who suspect Pegasus malware on their phones to contact the committee.', 'The public notice asked such citizens to explain why they suspect their devices were infected and whether they would permit the committee to inspect their devices.', 'The notice instructed suspected individuals to send an email to the technical committee before January 7, 2022.', 'The committee stated it would request permission to examine devices if it deems further investigation necessary based on the reasons provided.', "The committee will provide a receipt for devices received and a digital photograph for the user's records.", 'The notice said mobile phones would be collected in New Delhi and returned after inspection was completed.', 'The Supreme Court directed an expert committee to investigate allegations that Pegasus spyware was used to spy on opposition leaders, activists, industrialists, judges, and journalists.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Reporting; Incident Investigation; Testing & Auditing

mitigation_taken: The National Communications Commission tested Xiaomi Mi 10T 5G phones sold in Taiwan and reported finding built-in software that performed politically sensitive word checks.; The NCC issued a public reminder advising citizens to be vigilant about their mobile phone personal data and privacy protection.; Xiaomi Taiwan issued a public statement reiterating that Xiaomi has never and will never restrict, transmit, or block any phone users' personal behaviors such as searching, calling, browsing the web, or using third-party messaging apps.; Xiaomi publicly explained that the report referred to their ad management software and that the MiAdBlacklistConfig file is used to manage paid advertisements within Xiaomi's apps to protect users from content like pornography, violence, hate speech, or information that may offend local users.; Xiaomi publicly emphasized that user privacy and security are their goals and that it operates to the highest standards and complies with local and regional laws and regulations.

mitigation_taken: Protesters occupied the Columbia University physics building and wrote leaflets to persuade five faculty physicists to sever their connections with the Pentagon's Jason Defense Advisory Group.; The Turkish government-owned weapons company's website was altered to emphasize its adherence to a supposed 'man-in-the-loop' principle.; The signatories to the U.N. Convention on Certain Conventional Weapons held a conference in December 2021 to discuss whether autonomous weapons should fall under its jurisdiction and prohibitions.; A draft final document for the December 2021 CCW conference was issued before the conference opened.; A Group of Government Experts convened in 2021 to provide technical guidance on lethal autonomous weapons systems but was unable to reach a consensus on whether such weaponry should be outlawed.; The United States delegation told the Group of Government Experts that a working definition of lethal autonomous weapons should not be drafted with a view toward describing weapons that should be banned.; The United States delegation advocated eliminating any language that might require 'human control' of such weapons systems during CCW discussions.; The Campaign to Stop Killer Robots launched in 2013 as a coalition of 180 organizations to oppose lethal autonomous weapons systems.; The Campaign to Stop Killer Robots provides commentary on the technical, legal, and ethical issues presented by lethal autonomous weapons systems and offers organizations and individuals ways to become involved in efforts to outlaw such weapons.; U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres publicly stated that machines with the power and discretion to take human lives without human involvement should be prohibited by international law.
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Societal Impact Assessment; Risk Management

mitigation_taken: Meta implemented product changes to combat climate disinformation, including adding informational labels to search results and posts about climate change that direct people to its Climate Science Information Center.; The company launched the Climate Science Information Center (CSIC) in September 2020 and later extended it to additional countries including Brazil five months after launch.; The Climate Science Information Center provides posts by experts, tips on how people can reduce their environmental impact, and solicits donations for relevant non-governmental organizations.; Facebook applied different treatments to content classified as false by independent fact-checkers, including downranking to reduce the delivery of that content to the public.; The platform reduced the distribution of an article classified as 'partially false' and displayed warnings to users that the piece contained misleading information.; After complaints from a congressman, the company removed the fact-check label from the article.; After complaints from a congressman, the company hid the article behind a paywall.; After complaints from a congressman, the company added a link to the fact-check at the end of the article.; Prior to the CSIC launch, the Policy team temporarily blocked videos from appearing in the top search tab for the terms 'climate change' and 'climate'.; The company corrected the temporary block when it inadvertently restricted Facebook Watch search results so that Watch results were restored.; Meta stated that it identifies content considered disinformative about climate with the assistance of fact-checkers in order to reduce its reach.
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls; System & Feature Restrictions; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Incident Response & Recovery; Third-Party System Access

mitigation_taken: The Israeli judiciary opened an investigation into the police's use of the Pegasus spyware.; The government's legal advisor, Avichai Mandelblit, conducted an investigation and concluded that the police's use of Pegasus was lawful.; The Minister of Internal Security, Omer Bar-Lev, examined the case and stated that the police do not engage in secret eavesdropping or phone intrusions without obtaining a judicial warrant.; The Justice Minister publicly stated that the ministry was not aware of the police using the Pegasus spyware without a judicial order.; The police spokesperson publicly denied the allegations and asserted that the police operate in accordance with the law and court orders.

mitigation_taken: The Independence Police Department is investigating the crash. The Independence Police Department identified the driver of the Tesla as 74-year-old Terry L. Siegel. Siegel's passenger was transported to a local hospital for treatment. Investigators plan to extract data from the Tesla's computers in the coming days to better piece together what happened. The National Transportation Safety Board contacted the Independence Police Department to gather more information about the incident.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Incident Reporting, Incident Response & Recovery

mitigation_taken: Russia's communications regulator Roskomnadzor demanded that TikTok stop including military-related content in recommended posts for minors. TikTok said it is testing age-rated content restrictions.
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Content Safety Controls, Usage & Access Limitations, System & Feature Restrictions, Testing & Auditing

mitigation_taken: Amazon patched most of the vulnerabilities the researchers identified. Amazon fixed the remote self-wake issue with Alexa Skills caused by extended periods of silence resulting from break tags. Amazon implemented systems to continually monitor live skills for potentially malicious behavior, including silent re-prompts. Amazon blocks offending skills identified during the certification process. Amazon quickly deactivates any offending skills it identifies. Amazon provides automatic software updates to Alexa-enabled devices when they are connected to the internet. Amazon allows users to trigger software updates by asking their Echo device to 'Check for software updates'. Amazon stated it is constantly improving these mechanisms to further protect customers. Amazon said it is committed to working with independent security researchers to secure its devices.
assigned_subcategories: Model & Infrastructure Security, Post-Deployment Monitoring, Third-Party System Access, Incident Response & Recovery, Testing & Auditing

mitigation_taken: Snap temporarily turned off Snapchat's 'heatmap' feature for Ukraine. Snap will still provide a curated public feed of snaps submitted by Ukrainians. Apple turned off live traffic information in Ukraine.
assigned_subcategories: System & Feature Restrictions, Market Access & Commercial Restrictions, Content Safety Controls, Usage & Access Limitations

mitigation_taken: ['The Executive Yuan approved four amendment drafts to the Criminal Code and related laws to prevent sexual violence.', "The Executive Yuan added a new chapter to the Criminal Code titled 'Offenses against sexual privacy and fabricated sexual images.'", 'The Executive Yuan packaged and submitted the four amendment drafts to the Legislative Yuan for review.', "The draft law criminalizes producing or distributing fabricated sexual images (deepfakes) with intent to profit, punishable by up to seven years' imprisonment.", "The draft raises the maximum penalty for distributing sexual images obtained by rape or coercion for profit by one-half, increasing the maximum to ten years and six months' imprisonment.", 'The amendments establish tiered penalties for unauthorized recording and distribution of sexual images, with penalties ranging from six months to seven and a half years depending on severity.', "The amendments make unauthorized recording of sexual images punishable by up to three years' imprisonment.", "The amendments make distribution of sexual images recorded without consent punishable by six months to five years' imprisonment.", "The amendments make distribution of sexual images recorded without consent with intent to profit punishable by nine months to seven years and six months' imprisonment.", "The amendments make filming sexual images by force or coercion punishable by up to five years' imprisonment.", "The amendments make distribution of sexual images filmed by force or coercion punishable by one to seven years' imprisonment.", "The amendments make distribution of sexual images filmed by force or coercion with intent to profit punishable by one year and six months to ten years and six months' imprisonment.", 'The draft of the Sexual Assault Prevention Act requires internet service providers to immediately restrict access to or remove illegal sexual images when operators discover them or when authorities are notified.', 'The removal mechanism contains an exception allowing operators not to remove content only if the adult victim consents or a prosecutor determines removal is not necessary.']
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Content Safety Controls; System & Feature Restrictions

mitigation_taken: ['A working group organized by the Department for Emergency Situations, together with the Government, the CNA, and several NGOs, began preparing an online platform to scan online press, blogs, and social networks to detect fake news, sources of disinformation, and propaganda related to the conflict in Ukraine.', 'Global Focus Center will provide material about disinformation to the Government.', 'The Government will analyze the information received and potentially act on it.', 'Global Focus Center initiated an independent coordinated mechanism to provide correct information to the public and to pressure the government to communicate more promptly, correctly, and completely.', 'Global Focus Center will create a protocol of collaboration between the task-force of experts and beneficiaries (including the government) that will specify clearly what the mechanism does and does not do.', 'Global Focus Center solicited contributions and ideas from several partners, including the government, and is awaiting their input.', 'They will use the Pulsar and CrowdTangle applications to identify priority discussion themes in the public space.', 'Experts will perform the final filtering of recommendations for reactions by state institutions or civil society and the private sector.', "They will transmit regular reports with recommendations for reaction to NGOs, employers' associations, trade unions, the government, academia, and institutions involved in communication on those topics.", 'When the mechanism is finalized, Global Focus Center will make it fully transparent and explain its methodology to anyone interested.', 'Global Focus Center is in discussions with international partners to identify and secure funding for the mechanism.', "Based on their methodology and partner input, they will choose and decide how the platform's search algorithms will be designed."]

mitigation_taken: ['Tesla rolled out the Full Self-Driving (FSD) Beta 10.11 update to Early Access Program participants to address phantom braking concerns.', 'The update improved the precision of Vulnerable Road User detections by 44.9%.', 'The update reduced predicted velocity error for motorcycles, wheelchairs, scooters, and nearby pedestrians by 63.6%.', 'The update decreased phantom braking incidents by about half for most users.', 'Tesla updated open car door detection to be more accurate.', 'Tesla made turns smoother through the update.', 'Tesla implemented a new optimization-based approach that decides which road lines are irrelevant.', 'Tesla limited the initial rollout of the update to Early Access Program customers with a safety score of 99 or better.', 'Tesla planned to expand access to thousands more drivers after testing the update with high-scoring drivers.', 'Tesla stated it would probably lower the access threshold to drivers who scored 95 if the update performs well.']
assigned_subcategories: Model Safety Engineering; Staged Deployment; Testing & Auditing; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Access Management

mitigation_taken: ['Lawyer Wang Yu called the 12345 hotline to report the Health Bao popup.', "When her phone number was blocked, Wang Yu used someone else's phone to call the 12345 hotline and successfully connected.", 'Wang Yu completed nucleic acid tests within 48 hours before returning to Beijing and within 72 hours after returning, and both tests were negative.', 'After the full text of the CCP Sixth Plenum resolution was published, Wang Yu was able to log into Health Bao and her health code turned green.', 'Wang Yu reported her Health Bao popup situation to The Epoch Times.', "Lawyer Ren Quanniu posted on Twitter that his Beijing Health Bao had appeared with a popup indicating he was a 'time-space companion'.", "Li Heping's wife posted on Twitter that Li Heping's Health Bao had a popup and that he was intercepted by epidemic prevention authorities until 6:00 pm.", "Lawyer Xie Yang told The Epoch Times that his health code had turned red and that he was labeled a 'time-space companion'."]

mitigation_taken: ['The police deployed drones equipped with face recognition software to monitor crowds and spot suspects.', 'The drone wing is getting cameras with face recognition capabilities effective from a height of 30 to 50 feet.', 'The police are acquiring infra-red and thermal scanning cameras for the drones.', 'The state government sanctioned Rs 3.6 crore to create the drone unit.', 'The police asked a few startups to build a dozen indigenous drones according to their specifications under the make-in-India programme.', 'A team of police personnel is being trained to fly the drones.', 'The city police are building a 2 kg drone with a flying range of 5 km for surveillance along riverbeds, parks, and remote places.', 'The city police are building a long-range drone capable of flying up to 15 km.', 'The city police are building a delivery drone with a 2 km range that can carry at least 10 kg of goods such as buoys, floats, and life jackets.', 'The drones will be fitted with night vision cameras and thermal scanners.', 'The police plan to set up control rooms in shipping containers at Marina Beach, T Nagar, and other strategic locations to monitor drone feeds.', 'Each container will be equipped with computers and a dedicated team to monitor the feed from the drones.', 'Each container will have a temporary drone pad on its rooftop.', 'Each container will be equipped with a power generator and an uninterrupted internet connection.', 'The containers can be shifted to different locations when VVIP movements need to be monitored to reduce response time in emergencies.', 'The delivery drones will be used to fly out buoys, floats, and life jackets to people in trouble at sea close to the coast.']

mitigation_taken: Since 2018, YouTube has applied an informational context panel on videos about topics prone to misinformation to present verified information about climate change and link users to the UN. In October 2021, YouTube prohibited monetization and ads on content that contradicts the scientific consensus about the existence and causes of climate change. When announcing its October 2021 policies, YouTube committed to carefully examine the context in which climate claims are made to differentiate content that asserts false claims as fact from content that reports or discusses those claims. YouTube stated that it acts rapidly on content that violates its policies and requires that all monetized channels comply with its rules. In February 2022, YouTube ended channel memberships and removed monetization from Ricardo Felício's YouTube channel. In 2020, the NGO Avaaz requested that YouTube stop recommending 'toxic' content and block monetization of videos linked to climate change denial. The Senate stated that it conducts publicity and guidance campaigns across its communication channels and social networks to combat fake news. The Senate stated that it maintains the 'Senado Verifica: Fato ou Fake?' fact-checking service.
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls, System & Feature Restrictions, Post-Deployment Monitoring, Market Access & Commercial Restrictions, Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ['Two hundred forty-two victims filed a police report to Bareskrim Polri regarding the DNA Pro losses.', "The 242 victims' report was merged into the existing Bareskrim register B/185/IV/RES.2.1/2022/Dittipideksus.", "Victims' legal representatives submitted files and evidence to police, including the bank account numbers of the founders, co-founders, and leaders of PT DNA Pro.", 'All the submitted bank account numbers were immediately blocked.', "Fifty-six individuals, including the company's founders, commissioners, directors, co-founders, and leaders, were reported to the police.", 'Victims filed reports citing Articles 3, 4, and 5 of Law No. 8 of 2010 on money laundering.', 'Earlier, 122 victims had filed a police report to Bareskrim Polri alleging losses of about Rp17 billion.', 'That earlier report was accepted as a public complaint (Dumas), and the police conducted an investigation based on a report from the Ministry of Trade.', "The Ministry of Trade's Directorate General of Consumer Protection and Trade Order (Ditjen PKTN) and Bappebti took enforcement action against PT DNA Pro Akademi for selling unlicensed expert advisor/robot trading.", "On January 28 the National Police sealed DNA Pro's office, after which withdrawals could not be made.", 'Kemendag, as a member of the Satgas Waspada Investasi, followed up the task force decision that had banned PT DNA Pro Akademi in January 2022.', 'Bappebti carried out security and enforcement activities intended to provide a deterrent effect to noncompliant businesses.', 'Victims included several public figures in their reports, alleging that they received funds or helped promote the illegal application.']

mitigation_taken: ['TikTok removed 80 million uploaded videos that violated its rules.', 'Powerful artificial intelligence systems combined with human moderators removed 94.2 percent of the removed videos before anyone saw them.', 'Automated systems automatically removed 17 million videos from the total number of removed videos.', 'TikTok provided its policies on protecting users during the war in Ukraine to BBC News.', 'Meta stated it will remove this type of content only when it glorifies violence or is extremely explicit or violent.', 'Meta said it is exploring ways to preserve this type of content and other content when it removes them.', 'Wendy Betts encouraged people to record possible war crimes using the Eye Witness to Atrocities app to preserve information for use in court.', "A report from Berkeley's Center for Human Rights called for the creation of 'digital lockers' where social media companies, NGOs and legal experts can store and review content.", 'BBC News sent inquiries to TikTok, Google, Meta and Twitter about their policies regarding this area.', 'Telegram maintains a very light moderation policy that allows videos removed on other platforms to remain available.', 'Telegram does not remove metadata from images or videos, preserving information about where and when content was recorded.', 'Some social media companies automatically remove metadata from images or videos when content is uploaded.', 'Human Rights Watch has repeatedly called for a centralized system to transfer data from conflict zones.']

mitigation_taken: The Taipei City Information Bureau pledged to re-examine the parts of the two projects that raised concerns. The Research and Evaluation Commission completed internal management guidelines for the projects after the projects had started. The management guidelines require that when collecting personal data involving other city agencies' statutory duties, approval must be obtained from the Taipei City Legal Department and the city government. The management guidelines require establishing a mechanism for individuals to choose not to have their recordings used.

mitigation_taken: The Republican National Committee, National Republican Congressional Committee, and National Republican Senate Committee shared a North Carolina State University study with Fox News Digital alleging Gmail filtered conservative candidates' emails. RNC Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel, NRSC Chairman Senator Rick Scott, and NRCC Chairman Congressman Tom Emmer issued a joint statement accusing Google of suppressing conservative voices and harming GOP fundraising. Google publicly rejected the study's findings. A Google spokesperson told Fox News Digital that political affiliation has absolutely no bearing on mail classifications in Gmail. A Google spokesperson stated that Gmail automatically adjusts classifications to match users' preferences and that Gmail users can move messages to spam or to any other category. Google stated that it has previously debunked the suggestion that Gmail discriminates by political affiliation.
assigned_subcategories: Denial & Defensive Based Actions

mitigation_taken: Donna Dawley filed a federal lawsuit in Wisconsin accusing Facebook and Snapchat of aiding in the deterioration of her son's mental health that she alleges led to his suicide. Whistleblower Frances Haugen provided information to the press and later to Congress about internal studies at Facebook and Instagram that found the apps negatively affected teenagers' mental health. Politicians in the US and the UK proposed legislation to regulate social-media companies like Facebook. Meta said it would pause development of a version of Instagram for children younger than 13. Snap said it offers in-app mental health resources, including suicide prevention resources, for Snapchatters in need. Snap issued a public statement expressing condolences to families who have lost a loved one to suicide. Snap said it is constantly exploring additional ways to support Snapchatters.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Whistleblower Reporting & Protection, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Training & Supportive Measures, System & Feature Restrictions

mitigation_taken: Meta said it is spending $50 million to gather input from external groups to consider privacy, security, and responsible design. Meta published a September blog post titled 'Building the Metaverse Responsibly' in which executives stated that human and civil rights are at the top of the firm's agenda. Mark Zuckerberg posted a response on Facebook disputing many of the Wall Street Journal's Facebook Files investigation claims. Meta stated that it employs many more people dedicated to fighting harmful content than any other company in its space.
assigned_subcategories: Societal Impact Assessment, Governance Disclosure, Safety Decision Frameworks, Denial & Defensive Based Actions, Risk Management

mitigation_taken: ["The research team trained deep learning models on chest X-rays to study the models' ability to predict patient race.", 'They trained racial identity detection models on non-chest imaging modalities including digital radiography, mammography, lateral cervical spine radiographs, and chest CT scans.', 'They used both private and public datasets to train and evaluate the models.', 'They evaluated model performance on unseen subsets of the training datasets and on completely separate datasets to test generalizability.', 'They conducted experiments investigating differences in anatomy as a possible mechanism for race detection.', 'They conducted experiments investigating bone density as a possible mechanism for race detection.', 'They conducted experiments investigating image resolution as a possible mechanism for race detection.', 'They investigated disease distribution as a potential contributor to race detection.', 'They investigated location-specific and tissue-specific differences as potential contributors to race detection.', 'They investigated effects of societal bias and environmental stress as potential contributors to race detection.', 'They investigated whether combining multiple demographic and patient factors enabled race detection by models.', "They investigated whether specific image regions contributed to the models' ability to recognize race.", 'They applied a clipping filter to images to remove color differences and then re-evaluated model performance.', 'They evaluated the ability of models to predict race from diagnostic labels alone and compared that performance to image-based models.', 'The scientists acknowledged the limited availability of racial identity labels and that their ground truth relied on self-reported race.', 'The researchers stated that forthcoming work will potentially look at isolating different signals before image reconstruction.', 'The authors recommended bringing social scientists and other domain experts into the design, development, deployment, and evaluation of algorithms.', 'They recommended that data scientists, before exploring data, assess whether there are disparities, which patient groups are marginalized, and the drivers of those disparities.']
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Data Governance; Societal Impact Assessment; Model Safety Engineering

mitigation_taken: Massachusetts, through a legal settlement, stopped a Boston-based advertising company from steering anti-abortion smartphone ads to women inside clinics that offer abortion services there. Michigan voters amended the state constitution to require police to obtain a warrant before searching someone's data. California voters passed a sweeping digital privacy law that lets people delete the data that companies collect about them. Apple, Google and other tech giants began taking steps to rein in the sale of consumer data. Apple launched its App Tracking Transparency feature that lets users block apps from tracking them. Some states began setting limits on tech tools to protect consumer privacy. Abortion rights activists suggested that people in conservative states leave their phones at home when seeking reproductive health care. Abortion rights activists advised people to turn off location services when seeking reproductive health care. Abortion rights activists urged people to study the privacy policies of the health apps they use.
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Data Governance, Access Management, User Rights & Recourse, Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ['The National Police investigated the alert received from Facebook about the social media post.', 'The police activated an operation that identified the reported profile as being used by a minor.', 'The police intervened a suspicious Instagram profile.', 'The intervention allowed authorities to locate and identify the account user as a 17-year-old minor.', "Personnel from the Public Ministry, the Office for the Defense of Children and Adolescents, and other professionals went to the minor's home to provide contención (support).", "Police visited the home of another minor who was aware of the reported user's actions.", "The Paraguayan Police published on Twitter that they had received an alert from Facebook and from the FBI's Argentina office.", 'The police made the incident public, citing worldwide events as the reason for publicizing it.']

mitigation_taken: ['SICPA developed a system that converts the original identity-document photograph into a 20-byte encrypted visual hash.', 'SICPA embeds the visual hash in a secure QR code on identity documents to prevent subsequent forgeries.', 'Victims are advised to provide updated photos when obtaining any new identity document.', 'Companies, governments, and border controls are advised to perform more exhaustive live-face analysis for identity verification.', 'Companies, governments, and border controls are advised to perform more precise facial-geometry analysis for identity verification.', "Experts recommended implementing two-factor authentication that combines facial biometrics with a confirmation message sent to the user's mobile phone.", 'Countries should implement digital controls at border checkpoints and electronically validate entries and exits rather than relying solely on visual inspection.', "Owners of lost or stolen passports should file a police report to prevent the document's use for entering a country."]
assigned_subcategories: Model & Infrastructure Security; Data Governance; Access Management; Incident Reporting; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ["Scarlett upgraded her PimEyes subscription to the $80-per-month service to manage her search results and omit her image results from PimEyes' public searches.", 'Scarlett got help in sending DMCA takedown requests to websites hosting the explicit images she wanted taken down.', 'Scarlett saved a copy of one of the images and used it to conduct another search that yielded dozens more explicit images.', 'Scarlett submitted an opt-out request to PimEyes in mid-March asking the site to remove her images from its search results.', 'Scarlett published a Medium post and tweeted about her experience on April 2 in part to prompt PimEyes to respond and honor her opt-out request.', "Scarlett upgraded to PimEyes' $300 'advanced' tier to conduct a deeper web search for images of her face.", "PimEyes approved Scarlett's opt-out request on April 5 and emailed that potential results containing her face were removed from their system.", "PimEyes' owner said the company will update its website to make the opt-out option easier to find.", "PimEyes' owner shared a link that anyone can use to request removal of data pertaining to specific photos of their face from the PimEyes index and said that link will become easier to find.", 'PimEyes said it plans to publish a blog post explaining the opt-out process.', "PimEyes said it will improve its facial-recognition software so it can better eliminate images that users do not want to show up in the site's search results.", "The article's author paid $30 for one month's access to PimEyes and searched for images of Scarlett with her permission to verify what images remained."]
assigned_subcategories: User Rights & Recourse; Content Safety Controls; Data Governance; System & Feature Restrictions; Governance Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ["The draft ministerial decree establishing pseudonymization procedures for the Revenue Agency's data was transmitted to the Privacy Authority for its opinion.", 'The Privacy Authority received the new draft of the decree on 26 May.', "The decree text was revised to incorporate the Privacy Authority's observations sent in February.", "The government is pushing for the Privacy Authority's approval by June in order to start controls in July.", "To avoid privacy risks, the control list will use pseudonyms instead of taxpayers' real names.", "Taxpayers' real names will only be revealed at the moment of sending the compliance letter or launching a formal assessment.", 'The government committed to increase the sending of compliance letters by 15 percent compared to 2019.']
assigned_subcategories: Data Governance; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Governance Disclosure; Risk Management

mitigation_taken: ["For 28 of the cases, Cruise pursued technological fixes to improve its vehicles' predictions of human behavior.", 'Cruise relaxed some driving rules in response to a 2019 accident by allowing its cars to adjust strict adherence to marked lanes so they could move around parked trucks or slow cyclists.', 'Cruise unredacted and released internal documents in February in response to a request by Reuters.', 'San Francisco fire, police and transit officials recommended requiring further approval before Cruise could add more driverless cars.', 'San Francisco fire, police and transit officials recommended forming a new working group of state and local officials to oversee Cruise operations.', 'A bicycle courier and a scooter rider filed lawsuits against Cruise.', 'Cruise said it is fighting the lawsuit arising from the scooter incident.', 'Bicyclist Christopher McCleary settled his lawsuit last month.', 'Waymo sought a court order to preserve the confidentiality of its comparable data, and its records remain redacted.', 'Waymo settled a 2016 car accident case.']

mitigation_taken: ['The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration revealed that more than 750 Tesla owners had complained by publishing that figure in its request for information.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration began an investigation in February into phantom braking in Tesla Model 3 and Model Y vehicles after receiving 354 complaints.', "The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration published a 14-page request for information to Tesla on the agency's portal dated May 4.", 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration asked Tesla to provide all consumer and field reports it had received about false braking, as well as reports of injuries, crashes, deaths, and property damage.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration asked Tesla whether its Full Self-Driving and automatic emergency braking systems were activated during any of the incidents.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration stated that its probe covers approximately 416,000 Tesla vehicles from the 2021 and 2022 model years.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration gave Tesla until June 20 to respond to the information requests while allowing the company to request an extension.', 'The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration announced it was examining vehicles equipped with automated driving assistance systems such as adaptive cruise control and Autopilot.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Incident Reporting; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates

mitigation_taken: ['Comprova contacted the author of the Twitter post via Instagram but received no response before publication of the fact-check.', 'Comprova used keyword searches and source comparisons to verify the originality of the images, audio, and video used in the post.', 'Comprova contacted the Instituto Lula to clarify questions about the posting.', 'Comprova contacted the Partido dos Trabalhadores to clarify questions about the posting.', 'Comprova contacted the Tribunal Superior Eleitoral to clarify questions about the posting.', 'Comprova contacted the Polícia Federal to clarify questions about the posting.', 'Comprova published a fact-check concluding that the montage of videos and audios attributing a threat to Lula was false.', 'The Partido dos Trabalhadores issued a public note labeling the alleged statements as lies and denouncing the actions of prosecutors and the former judge Sergio Moro.', 'The Instituto Lula publicly stated that the recording attributed to Lula was false.', 'The fact-checking agency Fato ou Fake classified the audio as false.', 'Estadão Verifica classified the audio as false.', 'Aos Fatos classified the audio as false.', 'The news outlet Veja reported that the recording was false.', 'The news outlet G1 reported that the recording was false.', "In August 2020 the Supreme Federal Court decided to remove Antonio Palocci's deposition from the case records.", "The Superior Tribunal de Justiça suspended the execution of Lula's sentence in 2021 and determined that convictions from Curitiba should be annulled and the process sent to the Electoral Court.", 'The Supreme Federal Court annulled the sentence related to the Atibaia case on the grounds of partiality by Judge Sergio Moro.', 'The 12th Federal Court in Brasília rejected the indictment against Lula in August 2021 for insufficient evidence and prescription.', 'The triplex case was archived in January of the referenced year due to prescription.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Incident Reporting; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Societal Impact Assessment

mitigation_taken: ["Google agreed to pay $100 million to settle claims that it violated Illinois' Biometric Information Privacy Act through its Google Photos service.", 'Affected Google Photos users who used the service between May 1, 2015 and April 25, 2022 are eligible to claim compensation under the settlement.', 'Payments to eligible users will range between $200 and $400 per person depending on the number of claims filed.', 'Users who choose to exclude themselves from the settlement will not receive compensation but will retain the right to file their own lawsuits against Google or any released parties.']

mitigation_taken: ["Alexis's parents limited her screen time.", "Alexis's parents got her a therapy dog named Draco.", 'Alexis was hospitalised for anorexia, major depressive disorder, and anxiety.', 'Alexis underwent professional counselling.', 'Alexis underwent in-patient treatment programs.', 'Alexis underwent out-patient treatment programs.', 'Alexis participated in eating disorder programs.', 'Alexis and her mother spoke out about the negative effects of social media in an interview with NBC News.', 'Alexis and her mother shared a drawing she made during the NBC News interview showing her distress.', "The Social Media Victims Law Center filed a lawsuit against Meta/Instagram on Alexis's behalf.", 'Alexis must stay in constant contact with her doctors to manage her recovery.', 'Alexis fights to stay in recovery every day.']

mitigation_taken: ['The privacy authority opened an investigation into the Progetto Pollicino mobility survey promoted by the Foundation for Sustainable Development and the Ministries of Ecological Transition and Infrastructure and Sustainable Mobility with involvement of the Municipality of Bologna.', 'The privacy authority opened an investigation into the "portafoglio del cittadino virtuoso" initiative launched by the Municipality of Bologna.', 'The privacy authority opened an investigation into the initiative launched by the Municipality of Fidenza concerning the "carta dell\'assegnatario" and its points-based mechanism.', 'The authority requested that the involved entities provide information about the role of public bodies in the data collection.', 'The authority requested that the involved entities provide information about the legal basis for the processing of the data.', 'The authority requested that the involved entities provide information about how the system and the application operate.', 'The authority called on all local authorities to evaluate with the utmost care the adoption of similar projects.', 'The authority urged all local authorities to carry out thorough impact assessments.', 'The authority reserved the right to adopt any measures based on the results of the ongoing investigations.']

mitigation_taken: ["Researchers conducted Google Image searches for the keyword 'person' in the dominant local language across 37 countries to assess gender bias in search results.", 'They repeated the study three months later with a sample of 52 countries, including 31 from the first study, to reaffirm that algorithmic output reflects societal gender disparities.', 'Vlasceanu and Amodio conducted a series of experiments involving nearly 400 U.S. participants to determine whether exposure to algorithmic outputs can shape perceptions and hiring decisions.', 'In these experiments, they presented participants with Google image search results that mimicked gender compositions of professions from high-inequality and low-inequality countries to test effects on prototypicality judgments.', 'They assessed the impact on hiring by asking participants to judge the likelihood that a man or woman would be hired for a profession and by having them choose between male and female job candidates based on presented images.']

mitigation_taken: ['Starting July 13, Valorant will begin listening to and recording in-game voice communication to train a language model to identify toxic chat.', 'The system will be limited to North American English-only servers during the pilot.', 'Riot Games updated its Privacy Notice and Terms of Service to allow recording and evaluating voice communications when a report for disruptive behavior is submitted.', 'The updated Terms of Service were applied to all of Riot’s games.', 'Riot will pilot and test the software solution in Valorant before rolling it out to other games.', 'When a player submits a report for disruptive or offensive behavior in voice communications, Riot will store the relevant audio data in the player’s account registered region.', 'When a player submits a report for disruptive or offensive behavior in voice communications, Riot will evaluate the stored audio data to determine if the behavior agreement was violated.', 'If a violation is detected, Riot will take action.', 'Riot will make the audio data available to the player in violation before deleting it once it is no longer needed for reviews.', 'If no violation is detected, or if no report is filed in a timely manner, Riot will delete the audio data.', 'Riot will not actively monitor live game communications and will only potentially listen to and review voice logs when disruptive voice behavior is reported.', 'During the training period, Riot will not use voice evaluation for disruptive behavior reports.', 'Riot committed to updating users with concrete plans about how the voice data collection system will work before it starts collecting voice data.']

mitigation_taken: ['In 2014, the International Committee of the Red Cross convened experts to identify issues raised by autonomous weapon systems.', 'In 2020, the International Committee of the Red Cross and the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute convened international experts to identify what controls on autonomous weapon systems would be needed.', 'In 2017 the United Nations convened a group of governmental experts, and those experts continued discussions through 2022 to debate the development and use of lethal autonomous weapon systems.', 'The campaign group Stop the Killer Robots called for an international ban on lethal autonomous weapon systems.', 'Ethicist Deane-Peter Baker convened the Canberra Group of independent international experts to address lethal autonomous weapon systems.', "The Canberra Group produced a report titled 'Guiding Principles for the Development and Use of Lethal Autonomous Weapon Systems.'", 'The United States called for a global agreement to stop anti-satellite missile testing.', "Signatories signed NASA's Artemis Accords to establish principles promoting the peaceful use of space exploration."]

mitigation_taken: ['The Tamil Nadu Forest Department floated tenders from agencies to install an AI system to prevent elephant deaths on the Madhukkarai–Walayar railway tracks.', 'The department allotted Rs 7 crores for the AI project.', 'The department carried out a detailed survey and study to identify the most vulnerable elephant-crossing areas.', 'The department marked a 13 km area of forest land as vulnerable based on the survey.', 'The Tamil Nadu Forest Department and the Ministry of Railways decided to install an AI system to warn about trains when elephants attempt to cross the tracks.', 'Problem areas were classified into three zones: a 50 m red zone from the track center, the next 50 m as the orange zone, and a further 50 m as the yellow zone.', 'Acoustic (hooter) and luminous alerts will be installed at all sensor towers and in the console room.', 'If an elephant enters the yellow zone, an alert will be generated in the console room.', 'When an elephant enters the yellow zone, the console room will pass the message to forest watchers.', 'If an elephant crosses into the orange zone, messages and alerts will be sent to forest guards, watchers, forest range officers, and the railway station master.', 'If an elephant enters the red zone, district forest officials and divisional engineers of the railways will be alerted.', "District forest officials and divisional railway engineers will inform the locomotive pilot of the elephant's details and distance when the animal enters the red zone.", 'Work on the project is expected to commence within two months after the tender is awarded.']
assigned_subcategories: Staged Deployment; Risk Management; Incident Response & Recovery; Third-Party System Access; Post-Deployment Monitoring

mitigation_taken: ["The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) opened an investigation into Tesla's Autopilot system and the FSD Beta 9.2 software following a series of accidents.", 'The NHTSA published a report documenting that Teslas were involved in 273 of 392 crashes in 2021 involving vehicles with driver-assistance systems.', "The NHTSA was investigating 42 'special' traffic accidents, 30 of which involved a Tesla.", 'Two U.S. senators requested that the Federal Trade Commission investigate Tesla for potentially misleading consumers about its automated driving systems.', "Elon Musk stated that Tesla would restrict use of FSD Beta 9.2 'to the good drivers' and would verify users' compliance with company standards using telemetry data from their cars.", "The California Department of Motor Vehicles formally accused Tesla of making false or misleading statements about its 'full self-driving' capability.", "The California DMV said it is studying a series of measures in response, which could include suspending Tesla's license to sell vehicles in California.", 'The California DMV said it is studying a series of measures in response, which could include requiring Tesla to compensate drivers.', "Wettbewerbszentrale filed a legal challenge against Tesla's advertising in Germany.", "A German court rejected Wettbewerbszentrale's complaint against Tesla's use of Autopilot-related terms in its advertising.", "The Higher Regional Court of Munich accepted Tesla's appeal against a lower-court ruling that had prohibited certain advertising phrases."]
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Incident Reporting; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Usage & Access Limitations

mitigation_taken: ['The Irish Government sent a circular to both parliamentary chambers advising politicians to exercise discretion near smart speakers such as Alexa.', 'The circular instructed politicians not to store official documents on personal computers or mobile phones.', 'The circular instructed that family members should not have access to work devices.', 'The circular advised avoiding confidential work conversations near digital assistants or smart speakers to prevent them from being recorded or shared.']

mitigation_taken: ['Paaka Edwards contacted online help services and Apple customer service to seek assistance with Face ID.', 'Edwards exchanged his original iPhone 13 Pro Max.', 'He purchased another iPhone 13 Pro Max of the same model to try to resolve the issue.', 'He returned that replacement phone and purchased a third iPhone 13 Pro Max from a different batch.', 'After multiple attempts to get help, Apple told Edwards that there was no error in the Face ID technology.', 'Edwards spoke out about the issue on his TikTok account to publicize the problem.', 'He called on other social media users to encourage Apple to be more inclusive with their facial recognition technology.', 'He asked his TikTok followers to write to Apple with a specific message asking them to update Face ID to recognize cultural skin markings.', 'Apple has since gotten in contact with Edwards.', 'Newsweek contacted Apple for comment about the incident.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Reporting; User Rights & Recourse; Incident Investigation

mitigation_taken: ['Airbnb made its global ban on house parties permanent in June.', 'Airbnb is testing new anti-party technology in the US and Canada.', "Airbnb designed technology that automatically flags bookings likely to result in unauthorized parties by analyzing guests' review history, account age, length of stay requested, and whether the booking is for a weekday or weekend.", 'Airbnb trialed similar anti-party detection technology in select areas of Australia starting in October 2021, resulting in a 35 percent drop in unauthorized parties.', 'Airbnb used a similar system in the US since July 2020 that focused on guests under the age of 25.', 'Using the previous system, Airbnb prevented younger guests without a history of positive reviews from booking large houses nearby to where they live.', "Airbnb's latest rollout has a much broader focus with no mention of a maximum age limit.", 'Guests suspected and blocked from making bookings to host unauthorized parties may still be allowed to make alternative bookings through Airbnb, such as a private room or a hotel stay.', 'Airbnb suspended the accounts of around 6,600 guests for violating its anti-party rules in 2021.', "After the 2019 shooting, Airbnb said it would ban 'party houses'.", 'In 2020 Airbnb announced a further crackdown on parties amid COVID-19 concerns.']

mitigation_taken: ['IdentiFlight spent three years testing its anti-collision systems at six supervised sites across Germany.', 'Software engineers in Colorado are feeding hundreds of thousands of images of airborne lesser spotted eagles into an algorithm to train the system.', 'The trained neural networks are being linked to a camera system atop a 10-metre tower to detect eagles approaching up to 750 metres and electronically alert turbines.', "When alerted, turbines will wind down over 20-40 seconds into a 'trundle mode' of no more than two rotations per minute.", 'The system is expected to be certified for spotting sea eagles in the coming weeks.', 'Validation for spotting lesser spotted eagles is scheduled for 2023.', 'Germany’s environmental ministry drew up a conclusive list of 15 bird species deemed at risk of colliding with turbines.', 'Windfarms can in the future be built outside a 1.5km radius around lesser spotted eagle nests, down from 3km.', 'Wind park developers may be obliged to switch off turbines while nearby fields are being harvested to protect at-risk birds.', 'The new law will forbid switching off turbines for an entire breeding season.', 'The new law prohibits keeping rotor blades at a standstill if the farm’s energy production is diminished by 4-8% as a result, depending on location.', 'Animals not on the 15-species list cannot be cited to stop a planning application.']

mitigation_taken: The six firms wrote a joint open letter addressed to the robotics industry and policymakers. They pledged that they will not use their own robots or robotics software as weapons. They pledged that they will not assist others in weaponizing their robots or robotics software. They said they will, when possible, review what customers intend to use their technology for. They called on political decision-makers to collaborate to promote the safe use of these robots and to prohibit their misuse. They appealed to organizations, developers, researchers, and users in the robotics community to adopt similar commitments. Boston Dynamics publicly distanced itself from the live-streamed incident in which an artist equipped a Spot robot with a paintball gun.
assigned_subcategories: System & Feature Restrictions, Risk Management, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Governance Disclosure, Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: They collaborated with the manufacturer on follow-up research, testing, and production of the new UAV equipment. They compiled and published maintenance procedures. They compiled and published operation manuals. They compiled and published unit training procedures. They replaced the components with new parts in response to the braking anomaly. They formed an equipment research group to investigate frontline equipment faults and support training and equipment improvement. They regularly collected unresolved training-equipment problems from grassroots units and collaborated with universities, research institutes, and industry to investigate fault causes and promote equipment improvements. The equipment research group optimized data-analysis computations. They planned to jointly build an experimental platform with university research teams to conduct data testing. They implemented a battalion-level training model that reduced the training unit from the regiment to the battalion and optimized force organization. They encouraged personnel to study a broader range of disciplines to build richer operational and intelligence knowledge. The training department launched an internal UAV combat-theory journal. The party committee steered the journal's research direction while professional cadres independently selected specific research topics. They compiled their own training textbooks. They studied recent local-war cases to inform their training and doctrine development. They analyzed new operational concepts to guide doctrinal and tactical adjustments. They explored and developed new UAV tactics.
assigned_subcategories: Training & Supportive Measures, System Documentation, Testing & Auditing, Incident Investigation, Risk Management

mitigation_taken: Meta made improvements to Spanish misinformation prediction models after the Haugen revelations. Meta's Spanish misinformation prediction models now work at a level of precision similar to English for content the company sends to fact-checkers for review. Meta works with 90 independent fact-checking organizations around the world to review and rate viral misinformation in more than 60 languages on Facebook and Instagram. Six of Meta's 11 US fact-checking partners review content in Spanish. Meta removes Spanish-language voter interference content from its platforms. Meta connects people with authoritative information in Spanish through voting alerts and the Voting Information Center. Meta invested $5 million in media literacy initiatives ahead of the midterms, including fact-checking services on WhatsApp. YouTube applies its misinformation policies globally and says it applies them consistently regardless of language. YouTube employs more than 20,000 people around the world to review and remove content that violates its policies, including Spanish-speaking employees. Twitter is working with organizations such as the National Association of Latino Elected and Appointed Officials and MiFamiliaVota to promote voter registration. Twitter is working with the Spanish Language Disinformation Coalition to inform its policies on misinformation ahead of the midterms. TikTok launched an election center in more than 45 languages to flag inaccurate content and connect users to authoritative information. The advocacy coalition Change the Terms attempted to engage with major tech companies including Meta, TikTok, and Google regarding Spanish misinformation on their platforms. Change the Terms asked YouTube for more information on how well it is policing Spanish election misinformation. Change the Terms asked Facebook to ban theories that the 2020 election was stolen on its platforms. Free Press and a coalition of civil rights groups have been pushing big tech companies to take misinformation in English and other languages more seriously. Media Matters for America published an August report finding many Spanish-language videos pushing the 'big lie' were still up on social media platforms. Media Matters identified three Spanish-language YouTube channels that have violated content policies numerous times but remain online. Frances Haugen confirmed in a Congressional hearing that Facebook invests significantly in moderation in the US but that 87% of misinformation spending at Facebook is on English content. Frances Haugen released an internal Facebook memo that revealed the company assessed its ability to detect anti-vaccine rhetoric and misinformation as 'basically non-existent' in non-English comments.
assigned_subcategories: Model Safety Engineering, Content Safety Controls, Testing & Auditing, Training & Supportive Measures, Post-Deployment Monitoring

mitigation_taken: Many artists announced a boycott of AI-based image-learning services in response to the controversy. Some artists deleted their publicly posted artworks from the internet. Some individuals began pursuing legal recourse by invoking relevant laws and legal provisions. Danbooru issued a public statement revealing that AI generators had been trained on billions of images from thousands of websites, including artist platforms. Danbooru stated that removing works from Danbooru would not prevent AI systems from using artists' works hosted on other websites. DALL·E 2 implemented a policy prohibiting users from selling artworks created with the system. Open-source communities published explicit intellectual property guidelines forbidding use for adult, hate, or violent content and advising against using copyrighted materials.
assigned_subcategories: Market Access & Commercial Restrictions, Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Governance Disclosure, Usage & Access Limitations, Content Safety Controls

mitigation_taken: Dahua admitted to IPVM that the content on its website was authentic. Dahua said the website materials were outdated. Dahua thanked IPVM for pointing out the error. Dahua launched an investigation into the matter. In August 2022 Dahua acknowledged the authenticity of its 'Uyghur personnel real-time warning' document in a letter to the U.S. Federal Communications Commission. Dahua stated that the 'Uyghur personnel real-time warning' document was a historical internal software design requirement and that the company had never implemented it or put it into commercial use. In November 2020 Dahua told the South China Morning Post that it did not sell products emphasizing racial identification. In February 2021 Dahua changed its statement to say it had never provided ethnic detection products or services in Xinjiang. In August 2021 Dahua stated that it had never developed products or solutions intended to identify or otherwise target any specific ethnicity. In October 2019 the U.S. government imposed sanctions on Dahua for alleged human rights abuses related to its activities in Xinjiang.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Incident Reporting, System Documentation, Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: The Electronic Frontier Foundation filed a Freedom of Information Act request that uncovered the Fog Reveal program. The Electronic Frontier Foundation conducted an investigation into location data brokers which revealed the Fog Reveal tool. The Associated Press investigated and reported that nearly two dozen government agencies have contracted with Fog Data Science to use Fog Reveal.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: The plan to include language allowing police to use deadly force via robots has been put on hold. The two sides agreed that the robots will only be allowed to deploy pepper spray for the time being. Oakland police said they are conducting more research into arming robots with live rounds. Officers ensure a blank round is in the robot's PAN disruptor during deployments. The Oakland Police Department said it will not be arming robots with lethal rounds anytime soon. The department said that if lethal arming ever occurs, each event will be assessed prior to such deployment.
assigned_subcategories: Staged Deployment, System & Feature Restrictions, Usage & Access Limitations, Safety Decision Frameworks, Testing & Auditing

mitigation_taken: Google fired software engineer Blake Lemoine for violating a confidentiality agreement. Google publicly criticized Lemoine's claims about LaMDA as 'baseless'. The automated GPT-3 account's posting activity was paused after people discovered its unusually rapid reply rate.

mitigation_taken: The U.S. Senate Intelligence Committee began an investigation in July into whether TikTok misled Congress about Chinese employees accessing U.S. data. The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) launched an investigation into whether ByteDance's Chinese ownership could allow the Chinese government to obtain personal information of U.S. TikTok users. President Biden signed an executive order in September directing that CFIUS consider specific national security risks, including foreign adversaries obtaining U.S. persons' data and using it for surveillance, tracking, and targeting. A TikTok spokesperson told Forbes that TikTok collects coarse location information based on users' IP addresses and uses it to show relevant content and ads, comply with law, and detect and prevent fraud and inauthentic behavior.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Risk Disclosure

work is focused on protecting scalable swarms of unmanned aerial vehicles controlled by the cloud.', 'Researchers have implemented attestation schemes using cryptographically signed software updates mechanism and require a secret unlock key to make fabricated chips functional.', 'Efforts are underway to extend confidential computing to hypervisors running on RISC-V processors to isolate virtual developing new tools for detecting and responding to unknown and unexpected changes through a trust verification infrastructure combining monitoring, logging, and tracing.', 'Researchers are using offline profiling techniques to generate trust profiles for hardware and employing ongoing logging to ensure operational behavior adheres to those profiles.', 'Projects are exploring CHERI and related approaches to improve fine-grained compartmentalization at the operating system level using middleware, OS libraries, unikernels, and authorization mechanisms.', 'Researchers in Germany and Switzerland have implemented quantum-safe cryptographic algorithms and crypto-agility measures to protect drone communications and support dynamic updating of security algorithms.', 'A Brazilian research team developed the Cloud-SPHERE platform to integrate UAVs into IoT and cloud computing paradigms.', 'The Secure Systems Research Centre is developing a dynamic hierarchy architecture that 'The team has developed and implemented an open-source RISC-V processor and system-on-chip with specialized security features.', 'Data from successful attack scenarios are being used to inform modern designs and to train machine learning algorithms for defense.', 'A distributed optimization reconfiguration scheme has been designed to allow a jammed swarm to reconfigure itself to re-establish mitigation_taken: Camera-based security systems were installed on the 3,041 private public buses added to the IETT fleet. An algorithm was implemented to detect driver sleepiness, failure to wear seatbelts, and phone use via camera monitoring. When such incidents are detected, the algorithm reports them to IETT's general headquarters. Drivers detected to be drowsy, distracted, or using a phone are given instantaneous voice warnings. Drivers who do not respond to warnings are immediately replaced. After a third drowsiness warning, personnel intervene with the vehicle. After a third drowsiness warning, a driver change is requested. Passenger density is monitored in real time and extra trips can be scheduled on affected routes. An IP-based security camera system that records even when the vehicle is not running was installed in the buses. A passenger counting system was implemented so IETT can see how many people are on each vehicle at each location. A voice passenger information system was deployed.
assigned_subcategories: Model Safety Engineering, Safety Decision Frameworks, Post-Deployment Monitoring, Incident Response & Recovery, Risk Management

mitigation_taken: U.S. auto safety regulators opened a safety probe of the autonomous driving system used by Cruise after incidents where the vehicles braked inappropriately or became immobilized. Tesla has been under criminal investigation in the United States over claims that the company's electric vehicles can drive themselves. assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Market Access & Commercial Restrictions, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates

mitigation_taken: Alex Morales filed a class-action lawsuit against Apple alleging the Apple Watch's blood oxygen monitoring works incorrectly for dark-skinned users. The lawsuit was filed on behalf of Morales, all residents of New York, and residents of Alaska, Idaho, Iowa, Mississippi, North Carolina, North Dakota, Utah, and Wyoming. The lawsuit demands that Apple be held accountable for alleged racist impacts of the device.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies

mitigation_taken: Apple released iOS 16.1.2 in November that stated it included 'Crash Detection Optimizations'. Some emergency response directors shared their concerns about the false crash-detection alerts with Apple. Emergency response centers are communicating with Apple to request that the company pay more attention to the false crash-detection alerts. Emergency operators attempt to respond to each automatic crash-detection call triggered by iPhones and Apple Watches. Apple said it is aware of the problem and is working to resolve it.
assigned_subcategories: Model Safety Engineering, Post-Deployment Monitoring, Incident Reporting, Incident Response & Recovery

mitigation_taken: ["The Executive Yuan approved on March 10 last year four draft amendments to prevent sexual violence, including provisions addressing computer-synthesized false sexual images (e.g., deepfake).", "The Legislative Yuan's Judicial and Legal Committee approved in preliminary review the Criminal Code amendment draft in early May last year.", 'The Legislative Yuan passed in three readings amendments to the Criminal Code adding an offense for obstructing sexual privacy and creating false sexual images. ', 'The amendments define sexual images to include recordings of intercourse, sexual organs, or other private body parts that objectively may arouse sexual desire or shame.', "The amendments stipulate that photographing or recording another person's sexual images without consent is punishable by up to three years' imprisonment.", "The amendments stipulate that distributing sexual images without consent is punishable by six months to five years' imprisonment.", 'The amendments allow increasing the penalty by one-half if the distribution of sexual images was done with intent to profit.', "The amendments stipulate that recording sexual images using rape, coercion, threats, or other non-consensual methods is punishable by up to five years' imprisonment.", "The amendments stipulate that distributing sexual images recorded by coercion or other non-consensual methods is punishable by one to seven years' imprisonment.", "The amendments stipulate that reproducing, distributing, broadcasting, delivering, publicly displaying, or otherwise providing another person's sexual images without consent is punishable by up to five years' imprisonment and a fine of up to NT$500,000.", "The amendments stipulate that producing computer-synthesized or other technology-made false sexual images about another person that cause harm is punishable by up to five years' imprisonment, detention, or a fine of up to NT$500,000.", "The amendments stipulate that producing false sexual images with intent to profit is punishable by up to seven years' imprisonment and a fine of up to NT$700,000.", 'The Legislative Yuan passed an amendment to the Criminal Code Enforcement Act specifying that the Criminal Code Article 91-1 amended on January 7, 2023 will take effect on July 1, 2023.']
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; User Rights & Recourse; Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies

mitigation_taken: The Justice Department's Civil Rights Division began scrutinizing the Allegheny Family Screening Tool. Justice Department civil rights attorneys spoke with concerned individuals in November about how the algorithm could exacerbate disparities and explored the design and construction of Allegheny's algorithm. The Justice Department's Civil Rights Division cited the AP investigation when urging sources to submit formal complaints detailing concerns about the algorithm's potential bias against people with disabilities. Several civil rights complaints were filed in the fall about the Allegheny Family Screening Tool. Robin Frank filed a complaint with the Justice Department in October on behalf of a client with an intellectual disability challenging how the Allegheny Family Screening Tool assesses risk. Allegheny County updated its algorithm several times and sometimes removed disabilities-related data points. Since the AP's investigation published, Oregon dropped its algorithm due to racial equity concerns. The White House Office of Science and Technology Policy emphasized the need for more transparency to parents and social workers about how government agencies deploy algorithms as part of the nation's first 'AI Bill of Rights.' The Justice Department's Civil Rights Division issued guidance to employers warning that using AI tools in hiring could violate the Americans with Disabilities Act.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Incident Reporting, Data Governance, Usage & Access Limitations, Court & Law Enforcement Interventions

mitigation_taken: The U.S. Department of Justice opened an investigation into Tesla's driver-assistance functions. The Department of Justice sent requests for documents related to Tesla's Autopilot and Full Self-Driving (FSD) features. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is reviewing Tesla's Autopilot system. Tesla disclosed in a securities filing that it had received DOJ requests for documents related to its Autopilot and FSD functions.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: Brandon Ewing issued a tearful public apology during a live stream. The deepfake creator scrubbed their page on the site of deepfakes. The deepfake creator posted a long apology on their page addressing the non-consensual deepfakes. The deepfake creator said they would wipe their part off the internet. The deepfake creator said they would help decrease the number of future videos of those involved. The deepfake creator said they would not pop up again. QTCinderella livestreamed on Jan. 30 to speak publicly about how the incident affected her. QTCinderella vowed to sue the person who made the website selling the deepfakes. Sweet Anita tweeted that news coverage of Ewing’s apology was how she found out deepfake videos of her existed. Adept spoke out publicly about the situation on Monday.
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls, Incident Response & Recovery, Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, User Rights & Recourse

assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates

mitigation_taken: The Connecticut Advisory Committee called on state lawmakers to pass laws regulating the state's use of artificial intelligence algorithms. The committee urged state lawmakers to require independent audits of algorithms, including assessments of potential biases. The committee urged state lawmakers to mandate under state records laws that information about agencies' use of algorithms be publicly available. The committee said it would release a more comprehensive report within the next few months. Yale Law School requested information on algorithms from the state departments of Children and Families, Education, and Administrative Services under the state's Freedom of Information Act. Yale Law School released a report last year saying certain Connecticut agencies did not release full information about their use of algorithms. The Department of Children and Families provided the only complete FOIA response to the law school on the use of algorithms to identify at-risk children, disclosing basic information. The Department of Children and Families withheld the algorithm's source code, stating it did not have the source code and asserting it was protected as a trade secret. The Education Department produced only partial information about an algorithm it uses to assign students to schools. The Department of Administrative Services provided no information on an algorithm used to hire state employees and contractors. The Department of Administrative Services said it was working on a response. The Biden administration issued its Blueprint for an AI Bill of Rights urging government action to safeguard digital and civil rights. State Senator James Maroney said there will be a data privacy bill in this year's legislative session addressing government use of algorithms.
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Testing & Auditing, Governance Disclosure, System Documentation, Data Governance

mitigation_taken: A passenger in the Tesla was taken to the hospital in critical condition. Four firefighters were released with minor injuries after evaluation. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said its investigation into Tesla's Autopilot and associated vehicle systems remains open and active. The NHTSA is reviewing whether Tesla vehicles adequately ensure drivers are paying attention. Tesla announced a recall of more than 362,000 U.S. vehicles. The recall is to update Tesla's Full Self-Driving Beta software.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Incident Response & Recovery, Model Safety Engineering, Post-Deployment Monitoring

mitigation_taken: TÜBİTAK BİLGEM researchers developed an AI-supported 'Twitter Veri Analizi ile Dolandırıcılık Tespiti' system within two days. They made the system available for use by the Information and Communication Technologies Authority (BTK) and other relevant institutions. They opened the program as a web service for external access. The program scanned tweets containing keywords such as 'AFAD', 'Kızılay', 'AKUT', and 'AHBAP' to detect potential fraud. The program applied optical character recognition to attached images to convert image content into text. The program extracted IBANs from tweet text and images. The program checked the extracted IBANs against official institutions to determine whether they belonged to those institutions. The program marked account numbers that did not match official institutions as 'suspicious' and displayed them to the user. BTK reviews the tweets flagged as suspicious by the system and carries out the necessary actions. The system scanned 1,500,000 tweets and flagged 1,000 tweets as suspicious.
assigned_subcategories: Post-Deployment Monitoring, Third-Party System Access, Incident Response & Recovery

mitigation_taken: The motorist reported the incident to the fire department to request assistance. Firefighters evacuated the motorist. They coordinated with neighborhood authorities (RT/RW) and local residents and prepared supporting equipment. Rescue personnel used equipment such as webbing and ropes (tali caremantel) and other tools to attempt to recover the motorcycle. After about two hours, the motorcycle was successfully evacuated by the rescue team.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Response & Recovery, Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: Users should take measures to protect their personal information online. Organizations such as financial services companies should invest in state-of-the-art AI and machine learning technologies to detect and counter fraudulent trends. Visa employs Visa Advanced Authorization, which uses AI and machine learning techniques to determine the probability that a transaction is fraudulent in 300 milliseconds. Dating sites and apps should implement modern identity verification technologies, such as document-centric verification and biometric-based methods to better protect users. Organizations and stakeholders should increase awareness of romantic scams and improve detection capabilities to mitigate the threat.
assigned_subcategories: Access Management, Risk Management, Training & Supportive Measures, Model Safety Engineering
