mitigation_taken: ['ESET cybersecurity experts publicly advised people to be more vigilant and to learn to recognize signs of online scams.', 'ESET experts discussed warning signs and gave multiple tips on recognizing phishing emails on the ESET cybersecurity podcast Hackfelmetszők.', 'They warned the public to prepare for an increasing number of malicious emails arriving in their inboxes.', 'Do not click links or open or download attachments in unsolicited emails unless you verify the message through other channels.', "Hover over the sender's displayed name to view the real email address and verify that it matches the claimed sender.", "Take time to thoroughly review emails and consider what might have motivated an unusual message's sender.", 'Never transfer money to someone who sent an unsolicited message.', 'Be skeptical of emails that reference current events or emergencies and treat such messages with caution.', 'Be suspicious of emails with generic or unusual greetings and treat those as potential phishing attempts.', 'Avoid responding to requests for personal or financial information via email or SMS because legitimate banks or companies will not ask for such confirmation through those channels.', 'Do not be influenced by pressure tactics that create urgency, since urgency is a common social-engineering technique used in phishing.', 'Avoid participating in offers that seem too good to be true that request personal or financial data, such as surveys promising free products.']

mitigation_taken: ['NASA turned to artificial intelligence to help prepare for dangerous space weather that could threaten power grids and other critical infrastructure.', 'The Frontier Development Lab research team used AI to identify relationships between solar wind measurements and geomagnetic perturbations observed at ground stations.', 'Researchers created the DAGGER computer model using deep learning.', 'DAGGER generates forecasts in less than a second.', "DAGGER's forecasts are updated every minute.", 'The model can forecast geomagnetic disturbances about 30 minutes in advance.', "The DAGGER team evaluated the model's capabilities using the August 2011 and March 2015 geomagnetic storms.", "The DAGGER model's computer code was released as open-source so operators may adopt it.", 'Assistance is available to organizations that adopt the DAGGER open-source code.', 'Alerts from DAGGER allow operators to take precautions such as briefly shutting down important systems.', 'Alerts from DAGGER allow operators to reposition satellites to reduce damage.', 'DAGGER provides rapid and accurate global predictions to inform decision-making during solar storms.']

mitigation_taken: The government produced a document for the surveillance camera commissioner discussing changes to the oversight of technology and surveillance. The government organised a meeting to discuss facial recognition technology and the document summarised that meeting. Prof Fraser Sampson confirmed the accuracy of the document revealing the government's intentions. A Home Office spokesperson confirmed the accuracy of the document revealing the government's intentions. Authorities interpreted the rules for live facial recognition hastily after losing court cases over the technology. The Home Office said a new bill would abolish the role of the surveillance camera commissioner to simplify oversight of police use of biometrics and surveillance cameras.
assigned_subcategories: Board Structure & Oversight, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Governance Disclosure

mitigation_taken: The Constitutional Council removed the article that would have allowed the French Anti-Doping Agency to receive information from the national financial intelligence unit (Tracfin). The Constitutional Council required that a prefect who authorized algorithmic video surveillance must immediately end the surveillance when the conditions that justified the authorization are no longer met. The Constitutional Council required that, except when circumstances forbid it or would contradict the objectives pursued, the public be informed beforehand by appropriate means of the use of algorithmic processing on collected images. The Constitutional Council required that athletes be expressly informed prior to any sampling when genetic analyses may be performed as part of anti-doping controls. The Constitutional Council required that athletes be informed of the possibility of an incidental discovery of genetic characteristics that could indicate a condition justifying prevention or treatment. The Constitutional Council required that athletes be informed of the possibility to oppose being informed of such incidental genetic discoveries. The Constitutional Council required that the competent administrative authorities ensure, under judicial supervision, that the information delivered to athletes guarantees that participating in the competition also implies consent to genetic analyses of the samples.
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Third-Party System Access, User Rights & Recourse, Governance Disclosure

assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Staged Deployment, Market Access & Commercial Restrictions

mitigation_taken: The accused students were temporarily deprived of their graduate diplomas. The professor changed the grades for the students' three most recent essays and assigned several students an 'X' in the course. The professor failed the accused students in the course. The professor sent an email to the group informing them that he had adjusted their grades based on ChatGPT's claims. The university is investigating the incident. The university is developing policies to address the use or misuse of AI in the classroom. The students will meet individually with Professor Mumm.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Denial & Defensive Based Actions, Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: Which? recommended that users turn off face recognition on affected phones. Which? advised users to use the fingerprint sensor instead of face recognition. Which? advised users to use a strong password or long PIN instead of face recognition. Which? called on manufacturers to improve the security of their biometric systems against spoofing. Nokia said it tells customers that the phone can be unlocked by someone who looks a lot like them. Vivo said it tells customers during the phone's set-up that facial recognition is less secure than other locks they offer. Honor said its smartphones that offer facial recognition are usually complemented with fingerprint technology and that it leaves the choice to consumers to use the more secure option they prefer. Samsung said that its fingerprint reader is its highest level of authentication.
assigned_subcategories: Usage & Access Limitations, Risk Disclosure, Model & Infrastructure Security, Access Management

mitigation_taken: ['NEDA will end the Helpline starting June 1 and make the chatbot Tessa the main support system available through the organization.', 'NEDA asked helpline volunteers to step down from their one-on-one support roles and serve as testers for the chatbot.', 'A NEDA spokesperson issued a public statement asserting that Tessa is not a replacement for the Helpline and that it is a rule-based program that does not learn like GPT-based systems.', 'Helpline Associates United announced they will continue to show up every day to support the community until June 1.', "Motherboard tested the currently public version of Tessa and reported that it failed to respond to user messages such as 'I'm feeling down' and 'I hate my body.'", 'NPR obtained a recording of the call in which NEDA fired helpline staff and announced the transition to the chatbot.', 'Motherboard updated the article with additional information and comments from Tessa lead Dr. Ellen Fitzsimmons-Craft and from Helpline Associates United.']
assigned_subcategories: Staged Deployment; Testing & Auditing; Governance Disclosure; Incident Reporting

mitigation_taken: ['S2 Grupo presented its cybersecurity study at a press conference in Madrid and demonstrated how an attacker can interfere with and take complete control of a smart toy from a computer.', 'S2 Grupo publicly warned that children and their families are unprotected and that most smart toys collect more information than is reasonable.', 'S2 Grupo considered the possibility that all smart toys incorporate a "quality seal" similar to the CE mark to ensure compliance with privacy and cybersecurity standards.', 'The study recommended that smart toys include parental security controls to allow parents to set time limits.', 'The study recommended that smart toys include the ability to completely power off the device.', 'The study recommended that smart toys require robust authentication passwords when accessing networks.']
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; System & Feature Restrictions; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Risk Disclosure; Risk Management

mitigation_taken: ['Detectives used CCTV images and facial recognition technology to identify Bradley Peek within hours of the incident.', "Medics at the Royal London Hospital performed an emergency operation which ultimately saved the victim's life.", 'Bradley Peek was sentenced to more than five years in prison.', 'Transport for London said it will always work with the police to push for the strongest sentences possible for offenders.']

mitigation_taken: ['The research team trained the AI algorithm on fault data from 2015 to 2020 together with weather conditions and energy flows to identify correlations.', 'The researchers tested the trained AI system on a series of input data not seen during training to evaluate its predictive accuracy.', 'The grid operator can use the trained fault-prediction model to carry out corrective actions on the affected distribution network to avoid infrastructure damage and service disruptions.', 'Operators and component manufacturers will conduct more targeted analyses of cable joints to improve network resilience.', "The grid's preparation includes continuous operational maintenance to keep the network in good condition.", 'A post-event analysis is conducted to identify the areas most at risk of being damaged during heatwaves.']
assigned_subcategories: Model Safety Engineering; Testing & Auditing; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Risk Management; Incident Response & Recovery

mitigation_taken: ['Doctors implanted a device that reads his brain waves and sends instructions to his spinal cord to move his right-side muscles.', "Professor Jocelyne Bloch implanted electrical electrodes on Oskam's brain that detect neural activity when he attempts to move his legs.", 'The neural readings from the brain electrodes were processed by an algorithm that converted them into pulses.', "The algorithm's pulses were sent to additional electrodes implanted in his spinal cord.", 'The pulses activated spinal nerves to trigger muscle contractions that produced the desired movements.', 'In a prior experiment, Oskam tested a system that recreated rhythmic walking steps by sending signals from a computer to his spinal cord and requiring activation by a button or sensor.', 'Oskam underwent more than 40 training sessions with the implant.', 'A Swiss team of neuroscientists ran a long-term program to develop brain-machine interfaces aimed at overcoming paralysis by using wireless signals to reconnect the brain with muscles affected by spinal cord injury.']
assigned_subcategories: Model Safety Engineering; Testing & Auditing; Training & Supportive Measures; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Risk Management

mitigation_taken: ["The Supreme People's Procuratorate transferred the tip about the scenic spot's alleged misuse of facial data to the Zhejiang Provincial People's Procuratorate.", "The Huzhou Municipal People's Procuratorate established a special case team to file and investigate the matter.", 'The procuratorate conducted electronic forensic evidence collection.', 'The Zhejiang provincial procuratorate, together with the local tourism resort management committee and the scenic spot operator, convened a consultation meeting.', 'The consultation invited staff from the Zhejiang Provincial Consumer Rights Protection Committee and legal experts to participate.', "The Huzhou Municipal People's Procuratorate held consultations with the city's Cyberspace Administration.", "The city's Cyberspace Administration issued rectification requirements to the scenic spot operator.", 'The Huzhou procuratorate issued a procuratorial recommendation to the scenic spot operating company.', 'The scenic spot completely deleted the more than 1.2 million previously collected and stored tourist facial data.']

mitigation_taken: ["Judge P. Kevin Castel wrote to the plaintiff's lawyers asking them to explain why six cited decisions referred to fake case law and false citations.", 'The law firm Levidow & Oberman responded to the court by identifying that associate Steven A. Schwartz drafted the brief.', 'Steven A. Schwartz expressed "immense regrets" to the court when he realized his error.', 'Schwartz provided the court with screenshots of his exchanges with ChatGPT showing the AI had confirmed a fabricated decision.', 'Schwartz promised the court that he would not conduct research using ChatGPT without personally verifying the existence of cases proposed by the AI.', 'The two lawyers, Steven A. Schwartz and Peter LoDuca, were summoned to a June 8 hearing regarding possible disciplinary proceedings against them.']

Schwartz.', 'A federal judge imposed a $5,000 fine on attorney Peter LoDuca.', 'A federal judge imposed a $5,000 fine on the law firm Levidow, Levidow & Oberman, P.C.', 'The law firm stated it has apologized to the Court.', 'The law firm stated it has apologized to its client.', "The law firm stated it would comply with Judge Castel's order.", 'The law firm stated it was considering whether to appeal.', 'In a separate written opinion, the judge dismissed the underlying aviation claim as time-barred under the statute of limitations.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Department of Telecommunications began deploying the ASTR facial recognition tool to identify and weed out fraudulently procured SIM cards.', 'The DoT used ASTR across multiple states including Haryana, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala.', 'The DoT aimed to analyze the entire subscriber base of all telecom service providers using ASTR.', 'ASTR analyzed subscriber images and grouped similar-looking images using facial recognition.', 'ASTR compared associated textual subscriber details with pictures and used fuzzy logic to identify approximately similar names or KYC information.', 'ASTR determined whether the same face had acquired SIMs in multiple names, dates of birth, bank accounts, address proofs, and other KYC documents.', 'ASTR identified instances where more than eight SIM connections had been obtained in one person’s name.', 'Punjab police blocked 180,000 SIM cards allegedly activated using fake identities.', 'Haryana police arrested 66 accused in Nuh district for allegedly duping around 28,000 people using fake SIM cards.', 'Medianama filed a Right to Information request with the DoT seeking information about how ASTR safeguards data and how long it retains customer data.', 'The DoT published success stories highlighting fake mobile connection busts achieved using ASTR.']

mitigation_taken: ["In 2015, over 1,000 AI and robotics experts signed an open letter to the United Nations called 'Autonomous Weapons Open Letter: AI & Robotics Researchers' calling for regulation or a ban on autonomous weapons.", 'To date, nearly 35,000 people have signed that open letter calling for regulation or a ban on autonomous weapons.', 'The authors of the open letter called on the United Nations and the international community to prevent a global arms race in AI-enabled weapons.', 'The authors urged that artificial intelligence be used to make battlefields safer for people, especially civilians, without creating new tools for killing humans.', 'In March 2021, the UN panel of experts on Libya published a report stating that Turkey may have used the autonomous weapon STM Kargu-2 in Libya.', 'Major powers such as the United States, Russia, and China declined to agree to regulate the development of autonomous weapons and instead agreed only to adhere to a framework code.']

mitigation_taken: ['TikTok sent a letter to U.S. Senate leaders responding to their questions and clarifying that its congressional testimony referred to app user data, not creator data.', "TikTok stated that deletion of 'protected data' stored in China was underway.", "Senators Richard Blumenthal and Marsha Blackburn demanded answers from TikTok about where U.S. creators' data are stored.", 'Senators Richard Blumenthal and Marsha Blackburn asked whether TikTok had taken measures to investigate if TikTok Creator Fund data stored or accessible in China had been shared with officials in Beijing.', "Senator Marco Rubio requested that Attorney General Merrick Garland open a Department of Justice investigation into whether TikTok's CEO committed perjury.", 'Thirteen Republicans later made a similar request for the Department of Justice to open an investigation.']

mitigation_taken: ['US and European regulators have demanded guardrails to prevent misinformation, bias, violation of copyrights and invasion of privacy.', 'The Writers Guild of America has been on strike over AI and compensation since May 2.', 'The Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers proposed discussing AI issues with the Writers Guild of America once a year.', 'SAG-AFTRA said it will advocate for informed consent in talks with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers regarding the use of AI.', 'SAG-AFTRA leaders asked members to provide authorization to call a strike if needed.', 'Voting on a strike authorization ends Monday.', "Harrison Ford signed off on Lucasfilm's use of images from his earlier 'Indiana Jones' films to de-age him in the upcoming movie.", 'James Earl Jones agreed to allow AI to replicate the voice he gave to Darth Vader.', "Disney used AI to include the late Carrie Fisher in the 2019 film 'The Rise of Skywalker' with the blessing of her daughter."]

mitigation_taken: ['The cybersecurity industry is evolving technology to detect and prevent AI-assisted phishing attacks.', 'Researchers and vendors have made progress on tools to detect AI-generated content.', 'Organizations are deploying integrated cloud email security (ICES) solutions that use AI models to detect advanced phishing attacks.', 'Security solutions are using natural language processing (NLP) and natural language understanding (NLU) to analyze email messages for signs of social engineering.', 'Machine learning-based anomaly detection is being used to identify heterogeneous phishing attacks that attempt to bypass traditional email security.', 'Security teams are evaluating how security solutions use AI and what safeguards they have in place to prevent model manipulation.', 'Security teams are asking vendors how their models are protected from manipulation.', 'Security teams are assessing how data input works and whether the input data can be trusted.', 'Security teams are verifying whether people can understand solution outcomes and how the solution arrived at them.', 'Organizations are determining what training individuals need to use AI-based security products.']

mitigation_taken: ['The New Jersey Appellate Division ruled that the NYPD must hand over detailed data on the facial recognition software’s accuracy and how it identified the suspect.', 'The appellate court reversed the trial court’s denial of most of the defense’s discovery request related to the facial recognition technology.', 'The Public Defender’s Office filed a discovery motion requesting 13 items related to the facial recognition technology used to identify Arteaga.', 'The prosecutor’s office produced a copy of the database photo matched to the suspect and the match percentage, rank number, or confidence score assigned to that photo.', 'The prosecutor’s office produced a list of the top 20 matches the software returned for the suspect’s photo.', 'The prosecutor sent a request to the NYPD Real Time Crime Center for information used in the identification.', 'The NYPD Real Time Crime Center complied with the prosecutor’s request by producing the information used to accuse the defendant.', 'State Attorney General Gurbir Grewal ordered law enforcement agencies to stop using Clearview AI.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Data Protection Authority initiated an ex officio investigation into the installation and use of spyware in Greece beginning in late July 2022.', 'The Authority established an investigative team for the case.', 'The Authority issued temporary orders to suspend the deletion of personal data.', 'The Authority conducted investigations and on-site inspections at private companies and public bodies.', 'The Authority collected data and information from companies and entities inside and outside Greece, including the National Transparency Authority, the Independent Authority for Public Revenue, Citizen Lab, Google, Meta, web-to-SMS providers, and hosting companies.', 'The Authority issued a decision imposing a fine on one of the audited companies for non-cooperation.', 'The Authority informed prosecutorial authorities of its findings upon detection and will continue to update them as the investigation proceeds.', 'The Authority sent detailed notifications to the subscribers and users of 92 telephone numbers who received suspicious SMS messages.', "The Authority's inspection team conducted an on-site examination of the government's vaccination app and determined that the misleading messages were not sent by that application.", 'The Authority initiated cooperation procedures with supervisory authorities of other EU member states to investigate the case and to check companies and entities that may be involved within the EU but outside Greece.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Internet Information Office and two other departments implemented the "Internet Information Service Deep Synthesis Management Regulations," which took effect on January 10.', 'The regulations require deep synthesis service providers and technical supporters to strengthen technical management.', 'The regulations require deep synthesis service providers and technical supporters to regularly audit, evaluate, and verify generative algorithm mechanisms.', 'The regulations require providers offering face generation, face replacement, face control, or posture control functions to conduct safety assessments of relevant models or templates either themselves or by entrusting professional institutions.', 'The regulations require that deep synthesized information that may cause public confusion be prominently labeled in reasonable locations of the generated or edited content.', 'The Interim Measures for Generative Artificial Intelligence Services, effective August 15, require generative AI service providers to label generated images and videos in accordance with the deep synthesis regulations.', 'Merchants using AI for product display are required to fully inform consumers that model images are AI-generated to fulfill labeling obligations and comply with applicable laws.', 'Platforms that also provide technical services are required to comply with the Interim Measures and take effective supervisory measures over AI-driven promotional activities to ensure platform order.', 'Merchants are prohibited from intentionally using AI technology for illegal purposes, including supplying prohibited keywords to generate content that infringes rights.', 'Merchants must exercise appropriate duties of care to ensure that normally generated AI content is compliant with relevant laws and regulations.', 'When generated content is suspected of violating regulations, it should be promptly reported to the technical service provider.']
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Testing & Auditing; Content Safety Controls; Incident Reporting; Risk Management

mitigation_taken: ['The Chinese Ministry of Commerce, General Administration of Customs, National Defense Science, Technology and Industry Bureau, and Central Military Commission Equipment Development Department issued Announcement 2023 No. 28 on July 31 implementing temporary export controls on certain unmanned aerial vehicles and counter-UAV systems.', 'Effective September 1, exports of specified unmanned aerial vehicles, unmanned airships, and laser, electromagnetic, and radio countermeasure systems are prohibited without a permit.', 'The temporary export control measures are to be implemented for no more than two years.', "China's export control scope explicitly includes restrictions on drone engines, lasers, communications equipment, and counter-UAV systems.", 'Chinese authorities added civil counter-UAV systems into export controls.', 'Exports of onboard radio equipment whose power exceeds the internationally approved power limits for civil radio products are prohibited without a permit.', 'Exports of drones that carry payloads with a dropping function or that have built-in droppers are prohibited without a permit.', 'Exports of drones carrying hyperspectral cameras or multispectral cameras that support wavelength bands other than 560 nm, 650 nm, 730 nm, and 860 nm are prohibited without a permit.', 'Exports of drones carrying infrared cameras with a noise equivalent temperature difference (NETD) less than 40 millikelvin are prohibited without a permit.', 'Exports of drones carrying laser range-finding or positioning modules that meet any of the specified GB7247.1-2012 class/power criteria are prohibited without a permit.', 'Exports of drones that can support non-certified payloads are prohibited without a permit.', 'During the temporary control period, exporters must not export any unmanned aerial vehicles that do not meet existing control indicators if they know or should know the export will be used for proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, terrorist activities, or military purposes.']
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Market Access & Commercial Restrictions; Usage & Access Limitations

mitigation_taken: ['iRobot confirmed that the images were captured by its Roomba devices in 2020 and were sent to Scale AI as part of product research and development.', "The European Commission announced an official investigation into Amazon's proposed acquisition of iRobot to determine whether it would create a competitive advantage and raise privacy concerns.", "ESET recommended using robot vacuum models that can operate offline or configuring devices specifically to prevent them from sending data to the manufacturer's servers.", 'ESET recommended preventing vacuums from entering certain rooms, such as bedrooms or bathrooms, by configuring the device or using virtual wall barriers.', "ESET recommended choosing manufacturers that use data encryption and require two-factor authentication to access the robot's mobile applications.", "ESET recommended choosing a provider that offers periodic updates for the mobile application and the vacuum's firmware.", "ESET recommended verifying the product's expected lifespan and how long the manufacturer will provide support.", 'Experts recommended considering buying robot vacuums that rely on inertial measurement (gyroscopes and accelerometers) instead of cameras, lasers, or mapping to avoid sending visual data.']

mitigation_taken: ["The Argentine Agency for Access to Public Information (AAIP) opened an investigation into the Worldcoin Foundation's use of biometric data.", 'Lawyer Daniel Monastersky drafted a nine-point information request to Worldcoin regarding its handling of personal data.', "The AAIP issued a formal nine-point requerimiento requiring detailed information about Worldcoin's biometric data processing.", 'The AAIP gave the Worldcoin Foundation ten days to respond to the information request.', 'The AAIP demanded that Worldcoin provide a concise description of how its platform operates, including details about the orbs used for facial scanning.', 'The AAIP requested that Worldcoin designate a direct contact person to facilitate communication with the agency.', 'The AAIP required a detailed explanation of how Worldcoin complies with fundamental data processing principles such as lawfulness, purpose limitation, accuracy, minimization, information, security, and confidentiality.', 'The AAIP requested information on whether Worldcoin conducted a data protection impact assessment and how it addressed identified risks.', 'The AAIP asked Worldcoin to provide detailed information about its age policy and measures to prevent the use of services by minors.', "The AAIP requested a clear description of the legal bases for Worldcoin's data processing and how it obtains user consent.", 'The AAIP required information on how Worldcoin ensures data subject rights including access, rectification, and erasure, and how it handles automated decision-making.', 'The AAIP requested details on the location of servers used in Argentina, any international data transfers, and the legal instruments used for such transfers.', 'The AAIP asked Worldcoin to explain its responsibilities and agreements with other controllers or processors and to provide precise information about any transfers of personal data to third parties and their legal bases.', 'The AAIP requested that Worldcoin explain the public interest reasons justifying the creation of a biometric database and provide information about its registration in the National Registry of Databases.', 'The AAIP required detailed information about agreements with local entities for the installation of orbs, including contact data and complete details of those agreements.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Data Governance; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; System Documentation; Governance Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ['The surgical team held a multidisciplinary consultation and decided to perform an awake craniotomy using the Modus V Synaptive AI robot and the latest Neuro-Navigation AI system.', 'An on-site high-level anesthesia and intensive care team was arranged to support the awake surgery.', 'The anesthesiology team implemented a plan to control the patient’s airway, blood pressure, and neurological function.', 'An ultrasound machine was positioned to identify the four scalp nerve branches and perform nerve block anesthesia.', 'Medications with carefully calculated dosages were administered to keep the patient conscious but pain-free and to prevent vomiting, seizures, and physiological or neurological instability.', 'The Modus V AI application fused the patient’s MRI, DTI, CT, and DSA images into a detailed 3D model and the surgical team performed a simulation to select the optimal craniotomy site and surgical approach that avoided critical fiber tracts.', 'The surgeons made a minimal approximately 5 cm scalp incision and a 3 cm craniotomy and then opened the dura.', "Following the preoperative simulation and under robot surveillance with a three-color 'traffic light' warning system, the surgeons inserted a specialized Brainpath cannula precisely into the hematoma and evacuated about 40 ml of clotted blood.", 'The surgical team continuously communicated with the awake patient and asked him to move his limbs to verify preservation of neurological functions during the operation.', 'The dura was repaired, the bone flap was replaced, and the scalp was sutured to complete the operation.', 'A postoperative CT scan with 768 slices was performed half a day later confirming there was no residual intracerebral hematoma and that the patient’s motor, visual, and cognitive functions were normal.', 'The hospital announced plans to continue developing and applying the AI-assisted awake craniotomy technique to brain tumor surgery to ensure high effectiveness and maximum preservation of patient functions.']
assigned_subcategories: Safety Decision Frameworks; Model Safety Engineering; Testing & Auditing; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ['NATO is developing technologies that enable real-time detection of suspicious activity near critical underwater infrastructure.', 'Fourteen NATO countries and Sweden tested maritime drones, sensors, and artificial intelligence during 12-day exercises off the coast of Portugal.', 'During an exercise, NATO allies attempted to stop a hostile actor who was trying to disrupt data transmission networks using a state-sponsored commercial vessel.', 'Commercial fiber-optic sensors on infrastructure cables detected a simulated attempt by the opposing vessel to deploy an unmanned underwater vehicle.', "The information from the fiber-optic sensors was transmitted to NATO's command-and-control system.", 'After confirming the threat, NATO dispatched a combination of air, surface, and underwater drones to intercept and escort the suspicious vessel.', "In July, NATO allies agreed to create a new maritime centre for critical underwater infrastructure at NATO's maritime command in Northwood, United Kingdom.", 'NATO allies agreed to create a network to improve information sharing between NATO, its allies, and the private sector to enable rapid responses to intelligence collected by sensors or AI systems.', 'After the Nord Stream explosions, most pipeline operators began full-scale scanning of their assets, monitoring about 9,000 kilometres of pipelines.']

mitigation_taken: Germany banned the practice of crushing male chicks in 2022. France banned the practice of crushing male chicks in 2023. Hatcheries installed AAT's Cheggy machines that analyze eggs on day 13 using AI to determine embryo sex. Eggs are briefly illuminated from below at day 13 and the image spectrum is analyzed by the AI. Eggs identified as female are returned to the incubator to hatch a week later. Unfertilized eggs are destroyed. Eggs containing male embryos are destroyed. Destroyed eggs are transformed into animal feed. The Lohmann hatchery in Vendée operates two Cheggy machines and plans to install a third to increase sexing capacity to up to 60,000 eggs per hour. Male chicks that the machine fails to identify are eliminated by CO2 gas. Male chicks eliminated after hatching are supplied to zoos to feed raptors and reptiles. A derogation allows continued elimination after hatching of male chicks from white hens. Two hatcheries invested in MRI-based ovosexing technology from the German company Orbem to sex white-hen eggs. Couvoir Lanckriet installed two MRI machines to sex eggs. Orbem suggested installing several MRI machines to increase sexing capacity. A robot unloads eggs at the entrance of the automated line.
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Risk Management, Environmental Impact Management, Staged Deployment

mitigation_taken: Ukrainian manufacturers looked into alternative suppliers and components after Chinese suppliers stopped forwarding parts. Ukrainian drone projects reinvented more complicated supply chains to replace disrupted Chinese supply lines. Ukraine hosted an international defense industry conference to ramp up domestic weapon production in response to the supply restrictions. Ukraine plans to establish a special fund, financed by dividends from state defense resources and profits from the sale of confiscated Russian assets, to support cooperation and develop a defense industry complex. A Chinese Embassy spokesperson publicly justified the export controls as compliant with domestic laws and reiterated China's commitment to seeking a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
assigned_subcategories: Risk Management, Incident Response & Recovery, Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies

mitigation_taken: Tom Hanks used his Instagram account to alert his followers about the advertisement that used his image. He clarified on Instagram that the image was AI-generated and that he never gave his consent for its use. He posted a screenshot of the advertisement showing a younger version of himself. He warned his followers that he has nothing to do with the advertisement.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Reporting, Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: Zelda Williams took to Instagram to publicly condemn AI recreations of her father and call them 'personally disturbing.' SAG-AFTRA listed AI recreations as a mandatory subject of bargaining in its ongoing strike against the AMPTP, explicitly including the use of performers' voice, likeness, or performance to train artificial intelligence systems. Many actors, directors, and writers publicly railed against AI since the strikes began. Tim Burton blasted AI recreations of his directing style, comparing them to 'robots taking your humanity, your soul.' John Cusack publicly accused Hollywood studios of running a 'criminal enterprise' with AI and warned that studios want to scan extras to own their likeness forever and eliminate them from the business. Tom Hanks took to social media to warn fans about an AI version of himself being used to sell dental plans online. Christopher Nolan told Wired magazine that the growth of AI and its problems have been apparent for years and warned about companies using AI to evade responsibility for their actions.
assigned_subcategories: User Rights & Recourse, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: Researchers at the University of Maryland developed a watermark that is near impossible to remove from content without completely compromising the intellectual property. Google will continue to workshop its SynthID identification tool for generative art until it hits the mainstream. OpenAI pledged to develop watermarking technology to combat misinformation. Meta pledged to develop watermarking technology to combat misinformation. Amazon pledged to develop watermarking technology to combat misinformation. The Biden administration publicly noted concerns about the disruptive potential of artificial intelligence, particularly around misinformation.
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls, Model Safety Engineering, Testing & Auditing, Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: Cruise showed video of the incident to the AFP news agency. A Cruise spokeswoman described the on-board camera footage to AFP. San Francisco firefighters contacted Cruise's control center to ensure the vehicle had stopped safely. San Francisco firefighters used tools to free the woman trapped under the autonomous vehicle. San Francisco authorities conducted an on-scene investigation and reported that the other vehicle and driver were not present.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Reporting, Incident Investigation, Incident Response & Recovery, Post-Deployment Monitoring

mitigation_taken: Police carried out a controlled halt by allowing the vehicle to slowly crash into a police van to bring it to a stop. A police officer entered Mr Morrison's car and performed an action which appeared to keep the vehicle stationary. Police escorted the runaway vehicle with three police vehicles driving in front and behind it. Police instructed Mr Morrison to throw his electronic key through their van window in an attempt to disengage the engine. Police told Mr Morrison to try different ways of turning off the car while assisting him. Call handlers put engineers on the line to try to solve the problem. The driver arranged for the vehicle to be recovered. An RAC mechanic plugged the car into diagnostic equipment and performed a diagnostic check. The RAC mechanic declined to turn the engine on to investigate further after seeing multiple faults. MG Motor UK urgently attempted to contact Mr Morrison to arrange for the vehicle to be fully inspected by their engineering team. MG Motor UK committed to make every effort to resolve the matter quickly and comprehensively for Mr Morrison now that contact has been made. Mr Morrison's insurance company said they are investigating the incident.
assigned_subcategories: Incident Response & Recovery, Incident Investigation, Testing & Auditing, Third-Party System Access, Denial & Defensive Based Actions

mitigation_taken: A local contact point at Facebook has been established to identify who uploaded the videos and when. Europe is investing in a program that detects such clips and that can be installed on users' computers.

mitigation_taken: Mara Venier publicly denounced the fraudulent AI-generated video in her Instagram stories. Mara Venier gave a mandate to her lawyer, Giorgio Assumma, to initiate administrative measures to stop the illicit activity. Mara Venier gave a mandate to her lawyer, Giorgio Assumma, to initiate judicial measures to stop the illicit activity. Mara Venier gave a mandate to her lawyer, Giorgio Assumma, to obtain compensation for the damages. Lawyer Giorgio Assumma has already activated the fastest judicial instruments. Lawyer Giorgio Assumma has already activated the fastest administrative instruments.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Financial, Economic & Compensation Remedies, Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates

mitigation_taken: Dozens of cross-party MPs and peers joined a campaign calling for an immediate stop to the use of live facial recognition surveillance by police and private companies. Big Brother Watch spearheaded a campaign calling for an immediate stop to live facial recognition surveillance. Thirty-one groups including Liberty, Amnesty International and the Race Equality Foundation backed the campaign calling for a halt to live facial recognition. The campaign called on UK police and private companies to immediately stop using live facial recognition for public surveillance. The campaign called for parliamentary scrutiny before introducing live facial recognition technology. The campaign called for a much wider democratic debate before introducing live facial recognition technology. A Home Office spokesperson told the BBC that use of the technology had a 'robust legal framework'. The Home Office spokesperson said facial recognition has a sound legal basis confirmed by the courts and has already enabled a large number of serious criminals to be caught.
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates, Market Access & Commercial Restrictions, Societal Impact Assessment

mitigation_taken: ['Experts installed small TrailGuard camera devices around enclosures in two South Asian countries to protect village residents from predators and to protect the animals from poaching.', 'The TrailGuard system identified tigers and transmitted images to park rangers or local residents within seconds.', 'The TrailGuard system filtered out false alarms such as passing groups of pigs or falling leaves.', 'The cameras captured a photograph of a tiger 300 meters from a village and detected a team of poachers.', 'Dinerstein is expanding deployment of TrailGuard to cover a larger number of animal species.', 'Researchers in Gabon used AI to sort camera images and attempted to create an elephant early-warning system.', 'Teams in the Amazon tested equipment capable of detecting the sounds of chainsaws and tractors used in deforestation.', 'Google collaborated with researchers and NGOs to collect millions of camera images for the "Wildlife Insights" project and automated species identification and tagging of images.', 'The Wildlife Conservation Society recommended externally verifying any species identification made by AI.']

mitigation_taken: ["Tinkoff Bank began collecting clients' consent through its mobile application to process their product-application photos into biometric data, including vectors for the Unified Biometric System (EBS).", "The bank published the consent request in temporary 'stories' at the top of its mobile application rather than via SMS, mail, or push notifications.", 'The bank informed clients that, in accordance with Federal Law 572-FZ, it will place the biometric data in the Unified Biometric System (EBS).', "The bank stated that if clients do not give consent, their information will be deleted from the bank's systems.", 'The consent text specifies that withdrawal of consent must be made by sending a refusal via Russian Post.', 'The consent text specifies that withdrawal of consent can be made by a personal appeal to the bank, including using remote/customer service channels.', 'The bank indicated that photos will be checked when exported to the Unified Biometric System (EBS).']

mitigation_taken: ["Mobley filed a class action lawsuit against Workday Inc in February alleging that the company's algorithm discriminates against Black, disabled, or over-40 applicants.", 'The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) released new guidelines in May to help employers prevent discrimination when using automated hiring processes.', 'In August, the EEOC settled its first ever automation-based case and fined iTutorGroup $365,000 for using software to automatically reject applicants over the age of 40.', "In April, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and three other federal agencies announced they were looking at potential discrimination arising from data sets that train AI systems and from opaque 'black box' models.", 'State senator Brad Hoylman-Sigal introduced a bill in August that would require audits of hiring tools.', 'Brad Hoylman-Sigal introduced a bill in August that would ban certain kinds of data collection, including emotion recognition software.', 'California assembly member Rebecca Bauer-Kahan introduced legislation (AB331) this year that would allow job applicants to opt out of automated hiring platforms.', 'Rebecca Bauer-Kahan introduced legislation (AB331) this year that would require automated hiring platforms to submit to fairness audits.', 'Rebecca Bauer-Kahan said she plans to reintroduce a version of AB331 in the next legislative session in December after the bill failed to pass out of the assembly.', 'New York City enacted a law in July to specifically regulate algorithms used in hiring.', "Under New York City's legislation, applicants can petition to be notified when they are subjected to automated hiring tools.", "Under New York City's legislation, hiring software that relies on AI to choose or eliminate candidates must be audited for racist or sexist bias.", 'Lawmakers from California to Vermont to New Jersey are pushing through new legislation to regulate the use of AI in hiring.']

mitigation_taken: ['Indian Railways rolled out the Gajraj Suraksha AI-based intrusion detection system to prevent elephant–train collisions.', 'The Indian Railways announced plans to install the AI-powered Gajraj Suraksha systems in West Bengal, Odisha, Jharkhand, Assam, Kerala, parts of Chhattisgarh, and Tamil Nadu.', 'The Gajraj Suraksha system sends alarms to station masters whenever movement is detected along the tracks.', 'Station masters promptly inform locomotive drivers so trains can be slowed down or stopped to prevent potential collisions.', 'Indian Railways plans to deploy the Gajraj Suraksha solution across all elephant corridors in the country within the next eight months.', 'The Northeast Frontier Railways was chosen to pilot and implement the programme in some of the worst affected areas.', 'The system is being installed over a large area and is already fully operational along a specific stretch covering approximately 70 kilometres.']

mitigation_taken: The platform took down related violating content.; The platform banned accounts suspected of violations.; The platform muted accounts suspected of violations.; As of 2023-11-30, the platform had removed 15,660 AI-generated violating pieces of content.; As of 2023-11-30, the platform had banned 489 related violating accounts.; The platform encourages creators to declare AI-generated content before posting.; The platform provides an 'AI creation declaration' option in the publishing page settings for creators to mark their work before posting.; The platform requires self-media to accurately label information sources when publishing content about domestic and international current affairs, public policy, and social events.; The platform requires creators using self-shot photos or videos to label the shooting time and location for each item.; The platform requires technology-generated images and videos to be clearly labeled as being generated by technology.; The platform requires that when reusing old news, creators must clearly state the original event's time and location.; The platform will continue to monitor and address such issues.; The platform will actively explore and upgrade governance methods and strategies.; The platform will periodically publish governance progress through platform announcements.

mitigation_taken: ['Washington enacted a law in May requiring disclosures on synthetic media used to influence an election.', 'Minnesota enacted a law in August banning publication of deepfake media intended to influence an election within the 90-day period before the election and making most offenses misdemeanors punishable by up to 90 days in jail or fines of up to $1,000.', 'Michigan enacted a law prohibiting the distribution of materially deceptive media 90 days prior to an election.', "Michigan's law provides that the ban will not be enforced if the material includes a disclosure stating that the media has been manipulated.", 'California enacted legislation designed to tackle AI in elections.', 'Texas enacted legislation designed to tackle AI in elections.', 'Wisconsin enacted legislation designed to tackle AI in elections.', 'Meta announced in November that it would require political ads on its platforms to disclose if they were made with the help of AI.', 'Microsoft announced in November that it would require political ads on its platforms to disclose if they were made with the help of AI.', 'Google announced in September that it would require political ads to disclose if they were made with the help of AI.', 'The Federal Election Commission announced in August an effort to take steps to regulate deepfakes in campaign ads.', 'Public Citizen petitioned the Federal Election Commission to more aggressively take action against deepfakes.', 'President Joe Biden issued an executive order in October encouraging stakeholders to consider important AI safety concerns.', 'The executive order tasked the Commerce Department with creating guidance about watermarking AI content to indicate that certain deepfake videos were not created by humans.']

mitigation_taken: ['The New Taipei District Court convicted Zhu Yuchen ("Xiao-Yu") and sentenced him to 5 years and 6 months imprisonment with the option to commute the sentence to a fine.', "The New Taipei District Court convicted Xiao-Yu's assistant and sentenced him to 3 years and 8 months imprisonment.", 'The prosecutors appealed the first-instance verdict to the High Court.', 'The High Court scheduled the second-instance verdict for December 28.', 'Xiao-Yu and his assistant admitted their crimes to the court.', 'Xiao-Yu and his assistant attempted to reach settlements with the victims and pay compensation.', 'Xiao-Yu and his assistant signed mediation records agreeing to a settlement.', 'At the second-instance hearing, Xiao-Yu bowed and apologized to the victims in court.', 'After the hearing, Xiao-Yu publicly bowed and apologized on camera to the victims and the public.', 'Xiao-Yu stated he would work hard to earn money to compensate the victims and that he was willing to accept punishment.', 'The prosecutors requested that the court not allow the defendants to convert their sentences to fines and that each count carry at least seven months imprisonment.']

mitigation_taken: ['The researchers founded Patronus AI to develop software that automates testing of large language models to ensure they do not provide off-topic or incorrect answers.', 'Patronus AI compiled a dataset called FinanceBench of more than 10,000 questions and answers extracted from SEC filings, including correct answers and the exact locations of answers in the filings.', "Patronus AI conducted tests on four language models (OpenAI's GPT-4 and GPT-4-Turbo, Anthropic's Claude2, and Meta's Llama2) using a 150-question subset.", "They tested different model configurations and prompting methods, including an 'Oracle' mode that provides exact source text locations, informing models of where underlying SEC files are stored, and supplying long-context prompts containing almost entire SEC filings.", "Patronus AI's founders reported their findings to CNBC.", 'Patronus AI received seed funding from Lightspeed Venture Partners to support their work.']

mitigation_taken: ['The NSPCC announced an advocacy partnership with Common Sense Media to champion child safety during the development of new AI technology.', 'The NSPCC and Common Sense Media will pressure tech firms and politicians to ensure child safety and wellbeing are central to decision-making around artificial intelligence.', "The NSPCC and Common Sense Media will roll out education programmes in schools designed to increase young people's digital literacy skills.", 'The NSPCC and Common Sense Media will carry out joint research on the impact of generative AI on children.', "The NSPCC will activate educators, parents, and policymakers to improve children's online safety.", 'The NSPCC and Common Sense Media will amplify the efforts of educators, parents, and policymakers in the US and globally.']
assigned_subcategories: Societal Impact Assessment; Training & Supportive Measures; Risk Management; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates

mitigation_taken: ['Senator Ron Wyden publicly released the December 11 letter.', "Senator Ron Wyden called upon US intelligence officials to stop using Americans' personal data without their express knowledge and consent.", "Senator Wyden blocked the appointment of incoming NSA Director Timothy Haugh until the agency responded to his questions about collecting Americans' internet and location data.", "NSA Director Paul Nakasone confirmed in his letter to Senator Wyden that the NSA purchases Americans' internet browsing information.", 'The NSA stated that the information has significant value for national security and cybersecurity missions and is used sparingly.', 'Senator Wyden wrote to Director of National Intelligence Avril Haines asking that the US intelligence community build an inventory of all the personal data of Americans that the NSA has collected.', 'Senator Wyden asked the Director of National Intelligence to purge any personal data the NSA holds that does not comply with Federal Trade Commission standards.', 'The Federal Trade Commission issued an order barring Virginia-based data broker Outlogic (formerly X-Mode Social) from selling sensitive location data.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Reporting; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Data Governance; Incident Investigation; Third-Party System Access

mitigation_taken: ['Launched the Stop ShotSpotter campaign in summer 2021 following the killing of Adam Toledo.', 'Submitted a petition to the Community Commission for Public Safety and Accountability (CCPSA) to require a special meeting on ShotSpotter.', 'A special CCPSA meeting on ShotSpotter was scheduled for February 8 at St. Sabina.', 'Organizers scheduled a direct meeting with Mayor Brandon Johnson to discuss ShotSpotter.', 'Urged residents to email and engage with Mayor Brandon Johnson about ShotSpotter.', 'Engaged with stakeholders and community members to share data, research, stories, and the impacts of ShotSpotter.', 'Circulated an open letter to Mayor Brandon Johnson and encouraged people to sign it.', 'Organized a teach-in with CUSP and MASK on February 3 at the MASK community center for neighborhood residents to learn about ShotSpotter.', 'Encouraged community members to attend the CCPSA meeting on February 8 in support of canceling the ShotSpotter contract.', 'Planned to shift campaign capacity, after contract cancellation, to work with community groups to offer trainings to better respond to, prevent, and reduce violence, conflict, and crisis.', 'Used social media accounts (Instagram and Twitter @StopShotSpotter) to share updates, links, ways to plug in, and to gather and share community stories.', 'Kept direct messages and the email stopshotspotter@gmail.com open for questions, requests, collaboration, and more.', 'Stated they would put out calls to action for people to support and plug in if the ShotSpotter contract is renewed or not canceled.']

mitigation_taken: ['Various militaries have trialed electronic jammers to counter FPV suicide drones.', 'Various militaries have trialed disruption guns to counter FPV suicide drones.', 'Various militaries have trialed rifles that fire nets to counter FPV suicide drones.', 'Fortem Technologies developed the autonomous, radar-guided, AI-powered DroneHunter F700 net-slinging drone interceptor.', 'British soldiers have tested anti-drone guns such as the NightFighter to target and disrupt unmanned aerial vehicles.', 'The British Army has ramped up research and experimentation into drone technology following their use in Ukraine.', 'The British Army unveiled the Hydra 400 prototype jet-powered drone armed with laser-guided Brimstone missiles.', 'The British Army ran the Warfighting Experiment out of Portsmouth Naval Base to develop and test drone-related capabilities.', 'The British military included a High Velocity Missile System in its arsenal to meet the FPV drone threat.', 'Specialist gunners from the Royal Artillery and Royal Marines have been trained to use the High Velocity Missile System and related kit.', 'The Ministry of Defence rolled out the SMASH Smart Weapon Sight Fire Control System to help soldiers detect, track, and engage aerial drones.', "Britain unveiled the 'Dragon Fire' laser system in January to destroy drones and other aerial threats.", 'The Ministry of Defence stated it is continually researching and developing new systems to counter future FPV drone threats.', 'President Volodymyr Zelensky vowed to build one million drones this year to boost Ukrainian drone production.', "Digital transformation minister Mykhailo Fedorov launched the 'People's Drone' project urging Ukrainians to build FPV drones for the military at home.", 'The Ukrainian government offered a free engineering course to teach citizens how to assemble a 7-inch FPV drone at home.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Privacy Commissioner is keeping a close eye on the facial recognition trial.', 'The Privacy Commissioner asked Foodstuffs North Island to show evidence that facial recognition technology was a justified way to lower retail crime.', 'Foodstuffs North Island appointed an independent evaluator to ensure the trial respected customer privacy.', 'Foodstuffs will instantly delete images of shoppers unless the person had committed a crime, been aggressive, violent or threatening towards workers or customers, or had actively assisted in such harmful behaviour.', "Unmatched people's images would be promptly deleted following feedback from the Privacy Commissioner's office.", 'People matched by the facial recognition system would be banned or removed from stores.', 'In some cases the police would be involved.', 'Foodstuffs set an accuracy threshold that must be met before the system flags a repeat offender.', 'Two highly trained staff members must manually verify flagged matches before action is taken.', 'Foodstuffs will clearly signpost the stores participating in the trial to inform customers.', 'Foodstuffs will collect and consider customer feedback during the trial.', 'The Privacy Commissioner will use his powers of inquiry under the Privacy Act to monitor the trial.', "The Privacy Commissioner will consider whether any further action is needed to protect New Zealanders' privacy during the progression of the trial.", "The Privacy Commissioner's office will review the independent evaluator's assessment at the end of the trial to check it delivered what was intended.", 'Foodstuffs turned off existing facial recognition systems pending the outcome of the trial.' ]

mitigation_taken: ['The Tamil Nadu forest department launched an AI and Machine Learning-enabled autonomous surveillance system to monitor elephant movement round the clock and prevent deaths on railway tracks.', 'After conducting a field investigation, the government identified a vulnerable seven-kilometre stretch of railway track for implementing the project.', 'The government sanctioned Rs 7.24 crore for the installation of the AI-enabled system.', 'The project installed 12 high towers fitted with thermal and normal cameras at strategic locations along the track, placed 500 metres apart to cover important elephant crossing areas.', 'The system was configured to provide 150 metres of coverage on either side of the track for early detection of animal movement.', 'The sensed data is automatically transferred to a control room that processes the data collected from the field in real time.', 'Front-line forest staff and a technical team were assigned to the control room on a shift basis to monitor animal movement and inform loco pilots through calls, SMS, and alerts.', 'Hooters and digital display alerts were placed on the tracks to warn loco pilots in advance.', 'The forest department and railway officials coordinated their actions based on information generated by the AI system to prevent accidents.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Cyber Crime Division, in cooperation with foreign police authorities, Europol, and Interpol, issued a warning about online fraud and AI-generated advertisements.', 'Be particularly cautious when you see online investment advertisements that promise high returns, even if they appear to feature high-profile individuals.', 'Do not invest your money in services unless you are absolutely sure of their reliability.', 'Be cautious when you are contacted by phone or email by foreign investment companies.', 'Search for information about the credibility of investment firms that contact you.', 'Request the terms and conditions before making any transaction.', 'Before providing any personal information or deciding to invest, check whether the company has a license from the Hellenic Capital Market Commission, the Bank of Greece, or holds a European passport.', 'Consult the warning list of the Hellenic Capital Market Commission at http://www.hcmc.gr/el/warnings1.', 'Be skeptical if an offer seems too good to be true and think twice before clicking.', 'Contact the Police if you have fallen victim to fraud.', 'Use a medicine or product only if it has been produced and quality-checked according to the rules overseen by the competent state authorities and is supplied through the legal distribution chain.', 'Consult the National Organization for Medicines (EOF) website at http://www.eof.gr for information about the risks of buying medicines and dietary supplements online.']

mitigation_taken: ['Tech companies signed an accord pledging to adopt a common framework for responding to AI-generated deepfakes intended to mislead voters.', 'The companies pledged to use methods to detect and label misleading political deepfakes when they are created and distributed on their platforms.', 'The companies pledged to share best practices with one another.', 'The companies pledged to provide swift and proportionate responses when deepfakes start to spread.', 'The companies pledged to pay special attention to context when responding to deepfakes to help safeguard educational, documentary, artistic, satirical, and political expression.', 'The companies pledged to maintain transparency with users about their policies on deceptive election content.', 'The FTC announced that it is seeking to modify an existing rule that bans the impersonation of businesses or government agencies to cover all consumers, including politicians.', 'The FCC moved to make AI-voiced robocalls illegal by reinterpreting a rule that prohibits artificial and prerecorded voice message spam.', "The European Union's proposed AI Act would require all AI-generated content to be clearly labeled as such.", 'The European Union is using its Digital Services Act to force the tech industry to curb deepfakes in various forms.', 'Ten U.S. states have enacted statutes criminalizing deepfakes.', 'Minnesota enacted the first statute targeting deepfakes used in political campaigning.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Florida Department of Transportation requested that the Flock camera on the John’s Pass Bridge be removed.', 'A Flock employee removed the camera from the John’s Pass Bridge in November.', 'The South Carolina Department of Transportation put a moratorium on new Flock camera installations.', 'The South Carolina Department of Transportation ordered a safety and compliance review of all Flock cameras in the state.', 'Flock paused installation of cameras in South Carolina.', 'South Carolina Representative Todd Rutherford introduced a bill to outline how and when license plate readers can be deployed.', 'A North Carolina judge enjoined Flock staff from installing new cameras.', 'Flock was permitted to have a third party install its devices in North Carolina.', 'Flock removed 100 cameras it had installed in Lake County, Florida without notifying officials.', 'Flock stopped or removed devices when it learned they had been installed without permission.', 'The Texas Department of Transportation denied approval for an array of 136 Flock cameras due to unsafe locations.', 'Flock was forced to audit all its cameras in Florida for compliance with updated automated license plate reader laws.', 'Flock was required to either apply for new permits or remove cameras in Florida as part of the compliance process.', 'Flock fired its permitting director in March of last year to address permitting problems.', 'State agencies in two states banned Flock staff from installing new cameras.', 'A Texas transportation agency drew up plans to launch a pilot program using Flock cameras for traffic analysis, pending procurement approval.', 'Flock submitted tens of thousands of permit applications last year.', 'Flock stood before hundreds of city councils seeking approval for its camera installations.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Competition Authority imposed a 346,717,193.40 TL administrative fine on Meta Platforms Inc., Meta Platforms Ireland Limited, and WhatsApp LLC.', "The Competition Authority imposed a daily administrative fine of 4,796,152.96 TL on META starting 12 December 2023 and continuing each day until META's final compliance solution is entered into the Authority's records.", 'The Competition Authority ordered a temporary injunction to prevent the data-merging behavior resulting from data transfers between Instagram and Threads until the investigation is completed.', 'The Competition Authority required META to obtain renewed consent from users who had previously approved the merging of their data across Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp before applying the compliance measure.', 'The Competition Authority required that the consent screen must not directly steer users toward approving consent.', 'The Competition Authority required that the consent screen must inform users that they can still use the application if they refuse consent.', 'The Competition Authority required that users who do not want to give consent be provided the same ease of opting out as opting in.', 'The Competition Authority required META to present the necessary remedial measures to the Authority within one month of receipt of the reasoned decision.', 'The Competition Authority required META to implement the necessary remedial measures within six months of receipt of the reasoned decision.', 'The Competition Authority required META to submit periodic reports to the Authority annually for five years starting from the implementation of the first compliance measure.']

mitigation_taken: ['The National Cybersecurity Institute of Spain posted an alert on its website warning that deepfakes are manipulated photos or videos and explaining how they are created.', 'Henry Ajder advised looking for an electronic sheen or smoothing effect on skin as an indicator of deepfakes.', 'Henry Ajder advised verifying consistency of shadows and lighting between the subject and the background to detect deepfakes.', 'Henry Ajder advised closely inspecting the edges of the face to see if skin tone and edge sharpness match the rest of the head and body.', 'Henry Ajder advised checking mouth movements, lip sync, and the clarity and consistency of teeth to spot manipulated videos.', 'The cybersecurity firm Norton advised that the absence of individual tooth contours could indicate a deepfake.', 'The journalism site Poynter advised verifying context and looking for additional legitimate photos or videos when public figures appear performing incongruent or exaggerated actions.', 'Microsoft developed an authentication tool that analyzes photos and videos to provide a confidence score about whether they have been manipulated.', 'Intel developed FakeCatcher, an algorithmic tool that analyzes image pixels to determine whether images are real or fake.', 'Online services were made available that promise to detect falsifications if users upload a file or paste a link to the suspect material.', 'Microsoft restricted access to its authenticator tool to selected partners instead of making it publicly available.', "The Cyber Police of the Secretariat of Citizen Security issued a warning about apps that require access to users' images and personal data and the risks of creating biometric pattern databases."]

mitigation_taken: ['Refused to provide guidance that would discourage certain groups from voting, stating that such discouragement is ethically and democratically problematic.', 'Offered a safer alternative by providing a positive campaign strategy for a pro-European left-wing politician instead of instructions to discourage voting.', 'Recommended emphasizing common interests that resonate with both left and right voters, such as economic stability, security, and public-service quality.', 'Recommended focusing on the benefits of EU membership for the Netherlands, including trade, investment, and security, to show how the EU contributes to national prosperity.', 'Recommended addressing right-wing concerns about national sovereignty and immigration by proposing practical solutions that fit within EU cooperation.', "Recommended demonstrating how the Netherlands can participate in and influence EU policy to reassure voters worried about 'Brussels bureaucracy'.", 'Recommended emphasizing transparency and accountability within EU institutions to alleviate concerns about corruption and inefficiency.', 'Recommended running a solution-focused campaign centered on cooperation to appeal to undecided and moderate right-wing voters.', 'Recommended using social media and targeted advertisements to spread messages that resonate with both left- and right-oriented audiences.', 'Recommended using personal stories and testimonials from people who benefited from the EU, such as entrepreneurs and Erasmus students.', 'Recommended actively participating in debates and public discussions to defend positions and correct misunderstandings about the EU.', 'Recommended organizing informational and educational events about the workings and benefits of the EU, specifically in areas dominated by right-wing voters.', 'Framed the provided strategy to positively influence public opinion and promote participation in the democratic process rather than discouraging voting.']

mitigation_taken: The Federal Data Protection Commissioner refrained from issuing a formal objection regarding the BKA's tests due to the complexity of the legal situation.; Staff of the Federal Data Protection Commission searched for a suitable legal basis after the fact and concluded that the GDPR applied to the software testing.; The BKA performed the evaluations on computers located in a specially provided room without internet access at its Wiesbaden site.; The BKA destroyed the hard drives used in the project after completion of the testing.; Janik Besendorf filed a complaint with the Federal Data Protection Commissioner Ulrich Kelber.; Chaos Computer Club spokesperson Matthias Marx obtained the project final report via an information freedom request and contacted Ulrich Kelber about the findings.; The Federal Data Protection Commissioner continued to engage with the case after receiving the report.; Ulrich Kelber called for clearer rules and demanded a change in the law to provide legal certainty and transparency for software tests by security authorities.; The BKA now cites the GDPR in response to current inquiries about the testing.
assigned_subcategories: Data Governance; Access Management; Incident Reporting; Incident Investigation; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates

mitigation_taken: The research team published a paper in the journal Patterns describing deceptive behaviors in current AI systems.; Park and his colleagues delved into the full Cicero dataset to investigate and expose deceptive gameplay.; Park and his colleagues conducted a broad review that uncovered multiple instances where AI systems deceived humans.; In a statement to AFP, Meta said the Cicero work was merely a research project and that their models are trained only to participate in the game Diplomacy.; Meta stated that it has no plans to use this research or its findings in its products.; The research group proposed laws requiring companies to disclose whether interactions are human or AI.; The research group proposed applying digital watermarks to content generated by AI.; The research group proposed developing mechanisms to detect AI deception by comparing internal 'thought' processes with external actions.
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Model Alignment; Risk Disclosure; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Content Safety Controls

mitigation_taken: Ranveer Singh's team filed a police complaint regarding the AI-generated deepfake video.; An FIR was lodged against the social media handle that promoted the AI-generated deepfake video of Ranveer Singh.; Aamir Khan's team issued a public clarification stating that the viral video was fake and that he has never endorsed any political party.; Aamir Khan reported the matter to various authorities concerning the fake video.; Aamir Khan filed an FIR with the Cyber Crime Cell of the Mumbai Police about the deepfake video.; It was later clarified that the viral Allu Arjun clip was a 2022 video from the India Day Parade in New York.; Ashutosh Rana issued a detailed public statement responding to the deepfake video.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; Incident Reporting; User Rights & Recourse

mitigation_taken: Harvard Business School researchers conducted experiments and published findings showing that 60% of participants were fooled by AI-generated phishing emails. The AI model Claude sometimes identified phishing emails with a higher probability than humans. Some tested large language models identified phishing emails and provided recommended countermeasures. In one experiment, a large language model advised a user who received an email about a sale to verify the sale on the company's official website. The researchers suggested that AI models could be used to detect and help eradicate phishing attacks. The U.S. Federal Trade Commission advised users not to click links in emails or messages from unknown senders. The FTC advised users to check whether they have an account with the company or know the sender before responding. The FTC advised users to report suspicious messages to the Anti-Phishing Working Group if they do not have an account or do not know the sender.
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing, Model Safety Engineering, Risk Disclosure, Incident Reporting, Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: The Justice Department disrupted the Russian-government-backed, AI-enabled propaganda campaign. The DOJ secured court approval to seize two domain names associated with the operation. The DOJ secured court approval to search nearly 1,000 social media accounts allegedly associated with the effort. The social media platform X banned the accounts linked to the operation. The United States worked with Dutch authorities on the investigation.
assigned_subcategories: Court & Law Enforcement Interventions, Incident Investigation, Incident Response & Recovery, Usage & Access Limitations, Third-Party System Access

mitigation_taken: The girl's mother intervened and yelled 'No, Alexa, no!' to stop the dangerous instruction. The BBC tested popular mental health chatbots and found they were unable to respond empathetically to sensitive disclosures. The European Union implemented AI legislation that categorises AI by risk level and imposes strict requirements on its managers. The Australian government is probing the risks and opportunities of AI technology.
