mitigation_taken: ['Require human recruiters to review AI-generated outputs at critical stages, such as emails and candidate evaluations, to detect errors, biases, or unwanted results.', 'Perform regular audits of AI tools to identify vulnerabilities to manipulation, such as hidden instructions in LinkedIn profiles.', 'Kaspersky offers a specialized seminar on LLM security.', 'Train AI hiring systems with ethical parameters so they flag or ignore suspicious instructions in candidate data, reducing the risk of executing commands that damage brand credibility.', 'Inform candidates when AI is used for screening or communication to enhance trust and allow applicants to adapt their responses to avoid algorithmic misinterpretation.', 'Continuously refresh AI training data to improve model ability to recognize and filter irrelevant or malicious inputs and keep professional communication targeted.', 'Encourage recruitment teams to report anomalies in AI outputs to cultivate a culture of accountability that protects company reputation.', "Provide guidance to jobseekers on how to interact with AI, such as optimizing profile formatting and avoiding embedded 'tricks', to preserve the integrity of their personal brand in automated systems."]

mitigation_taken: ['The California Attorney General’s Office filed a lawsuit against the city of El Cajon, the El Cajon Police Department, and the police chief seeking a court declaration that sharing ALPR data outside California is unlawful and to force them to stop sharing the data.', 'In fall 2023, the Attorney General’s Office issued statewide guidance clarifying that under SB 34 agencies may only share ALPR data with other California state or local agencies and that sharing with out-of-state or federal agencies is barred.', 'The Attorney General’s Office issued multiple warnings to the city of El Cajon and its police department to comply with the ALPR law.', 'The Attorney General’s Office contacted other agencies about sharing ALPR data outside California.', 'Other agencies contacted by the Attorney General’s Office quickly ceased sharing ALPR data outside California and came into compliance with the law.', 'San Diego police publicly disclosed earlier in the year that it had shared ALPR data with federal agencies in 2024.', 'San Diego police announced that it had ended the practice of sharing ALPR data with federal agencies in order to come into full compliance with SB 34.', 'San Diego’s Flock Safety transparency page indicates that no outside agencies have access to San Diego police ALPR data.', 'Most police departments in California have stopped sharing license plate data across state lines.']

mitigation_taken: ["They introduced lightweight prompt edits that explicitly allowed models to reject misinformation requests.", "They added factual-recall cues to prompts to emphasize recalling correct relationships between brand and generic drug names.", "They combined rejection permission and factual-recall hints in prompts to improve models' resistance to illogical requests.", "They supervised fine-tuned GPT4o-mini and Llama3-8B on a 300-example PERSIST instruction-tuning dataset of illogical drug substitution prompts.", "They conducted out-of-distribution evaluations of the fine-tuned models across four domains (cancer drugs, singers/performers, writers, and geography) to test generalization.", "They evaluated fine-tuned models' compliance with logical requests using a 20-case test set including FDA drug safety recalls and other appropriate substitution scenarios to ensure no over-rejection.", "They assessed fine-tuned and base models across 10 general and biomedical knowledge benchmarks to check for performance degradation.", "They used an automated evaluation pipeline where Claude 3.5 Sonnet provided initial annotations and human reviewers validated outputs to categorize model responses and ensure annotation reliability.", "They made all input and output data and the fine-tuned Llama3 model publicly available at the Hugging Face PERSIST dataset repository.", "They published all code used for experiments at the Hugging Face PERSIST repository."]

mitigation_taken: ['Built and launched a province-wide intelligent human–tiger conflict monitoring and early-warning platform.', 'Deployed a standardized monitoring network of 165 survey units and 8,085 infrared automatic cameras covering 32,000 square kilometers of forest.', "Implemented AI-based individual identification software that recognizes each tiger's unique stripe patterns for rapid individual recognition.", 'Established a three-level early-warning and prevention system and demonstrated it in the high-risk villages of Muling Huashuhe, Dongfanghong Qiyuan, and Yingchun Baomashan.', 'Defined three concentric defense lines within a 5-kilometer radius of villages and set trigger distances for warning levels: 2–5 km for level 3, 1–2 km for level 2 (prepare drive-away measures), and 0–1 km for level 1 (ready for emergency handling).', "Integrated real-time monitoring cameras, intelligent drones, gas deterrents, laser deterrents, and ultrasonic deterrents to form a full-process 'monitoring–warning–drive-away–rescue' prevention system.", 'Deployed monitoring cameras with 4G and Beidou dual-mode communication designed to operate stably in extreme cold to ensure reliable signal transmission.', 'Integrated intelligent tracking drones with automated nests to enable all-weather patrols and seconds-level response.', 'Deployed laser deterrent devices that use specified laser power to encourage wildlife to move away.', 'Deployed anesthetic drone systems to provide a safe and reliable means for emergency handling.', 'Conducted strict testing of all technical methods to ensure effective deterrence without harming wildlife.', 'Implemented a rapid direct-report system allowing grassroots units to promptly report tiger appearances, send genetic samples for testing, and receive test reports.', 'Built integrated data collection, analysis, and application capabilities with data visualization functions that generate spatiotemporal heatmaps to support management decision-making.', "Planned to gradually expand the platform's coverage beyond the three demonstration villages and promote implementation in more high-risk areas.", 'Planned to conduct in-depth data mining and analysis of tiger cross-border migration patterns and habitat preferences to provide precise scientific guidance for ecological corridor construction.']

mitigation_taken: ['Several universities now explicitly advise against using detection software as evidence of academic misconduct.', 'Instructors can ask students to provide time-stamped drafts, version history, and checkpoints to document their process.', 'Short oral examinations can be scheduled for major assignments or throughout a term to verify authorship and assess depth of understanding.', 'Courses can include experiential learning components with external verification where students apply course concepts to real-world settings.', 'Students can include brief attestations from workplace supervisors, community partners, or other external stakeholders in their capstone assignments for instructors to grade.', 'Institutions must evaluate whether their asynchronous programs can maintain social presence, cognitive presence, and teaching presence given generative AI capabilities.', 'Institutions should invest substantially in the resources and policy support required to restore some degree of assessment authenticity.', 'Institutions should acknowledge that asynchronous programs as currently structured cannot credibly assure learning outcomes if they do not make the necessary investments.', 'Institutions must grant leniency to students requiring accommodations such as disabilities, inadequate technology, or lack of private space.']
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Risk Management; Training & Supportive Measures; Usage & Access Limitations; User Rights & Recourse

mitigation_taken: ['Analyze interlocutor profiles to assess how well they are developed and whether their photos are real or generated.', 'Attempt to call the interlocutor rather than limit communication to text messages to verify them.', 'Take a pause from communication if you have doubts about the reliability of a contact.', 'Report compromised or suspicious accounts to platform administration so those accounts can be blocked.', "Move communication to video calls as early as possible to check the interlocutor's reality.", 'Never transfer money or invest on the advice of a person you have not met in real life.', "Conduct 'tests of distrust' by asking tricky questions to probe the interlocutor's authenticity.", 'Listen to your close circle and take their concerns about an online contact seriously.', 'Slow down the development of online relationships and avoid rushing into commitments.', 'Require document submission and identity verification at registration to increase trust in the platform community.']
assigned_subcategories: Access Management; Data Governance; Incident Reporting; Training & Supportive Measures; System & Feature Restrictions

mitigation_taken: ['Admit that AI was used as soon as it is detected.', 'Act humble when an AI-related error is detected.', 'Self-report the error to relevant legal associations.', 'Voluntarily take classes on AI and law.', 'Judges sanctioned lawyers for AI-generated hallucinations and fake citations.', 'The court put the client on the stand after it was revealed she played a significant role in drafting the aberrant filing.', 'Ars reviewed 23 cases of lawyer sanctions using a database compiled by Damien Charlotin.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) asked airlines, pilots, and air traffic controllers to report GPS spoofing incidents within 10 minutes of occurrence.', 'The DGCA decided to put in place a system to ensure real-time reporting of GPS interference and spoofing incidents.', 'The DGCA issued a three-page circular on November 10 requiring real-time reporting of abnormal GPS behaviour within 10 minutes of occurrence.', 'The DGCA required that the initial report include the date and time of occurrence, aircraft type and registration, airline name, flight route, and coordinates or area affected.', 'The DGCA required entities to specify the type of interference (jamming, spoofing, signal loss, or integrity error) and the aircraft equipment affected.', 'The DGCA advised airline operators, pilots, and ATS units to preserve system logs as supporting evidence.', 'The DGCA advised airline operators, pilots, and ATS units to capture screenshots or images of the Flight Management System (FMS) as supporting evidence.', 'The DGCA advised airline operators, pilots and ATS units to record effects on connected systems and platforms as supporting evidence.', 'The DGCA asked all aircraft operators, flight crew and Airports Authority of India (AAI), including ATC and CNS units, operating in and around the Delhi airport to follow the instructions in the circular.', 'The DGCA is probing the incidents of GPS spoofing at the Delhi airport.', 'The DGCA is collecting reports of GPS interference and spoofing occurrences to obtain a better understanding of the situation.', 'The International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) and the International Air Transport Association (IATA) have been examining GPS spoofing and jamming and exploring ways to deal with them.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Reporting; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Incident Investigation; Post-Deployment Monitoring; System Documentation

mitigation_taken: ["DW conducted reverse image searches using screenshots to trace and document the video's distribution across social platforms.", 'A basic face-recognition search was performed that identified the person in the video as Vladimir Jurjevič Ivanov.', 'DW contacted Vladimir Ivanov and Aleksej Gubanov to request comment about the AI-generated videos.', 'The TikTok channel @fantomoko that first posted the AI video was deleted.', 'DW published a fact-check article labeling the claim that 23-year-old Ukrainians were being mobilized as false.', "Investigators identified that some of the videos contained a 'Sora' watermark indicating use of an OpenAI image generator."]

mitigation_taken: ['The Center for Countering Disinformation publicly declared the TikTok videos alleging the encirclement of Kupiansk to be fakes created with artificial intelligence.', 'Analysts at the Center identified and described telltale signs of AI-generated content, including unnatural facial expressions, templated voices, and incorrect stress on the word "Kupiansk".', 'The Center clarified that claims of a full encirclement of Kupiansk were false and that intensive fighting continues with Ukrainian forces resisting.', 'The Center advised the public to verify information sources and to approach sensational social media videos critically.', 'The Center investigated related TikTok videos and concluded that many accounts spreading them showed signs of a coordinated network created to promote Kremlin narratives to foreign audiences.', 'The Center pointed out that claims about a purported "methodology" lacked any evidence and were spread via anonymous sources without documents, photos, or official confirmations.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Reporting; Incident Investigation; Content Safety Controls; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Societal Impact Assessment

mitigation_taken: ['The Competition Bureau has concluded its civil investigation into the use of algorithmic pricing software in Canada’s rental housing market.', 'Landlords across the country have significantly reduced their use of revenue management tools since late 2024.', 'The Competition Bureau is issuing guidance for landlords, property managers, and software providers to support compliance with the Competition Act.', 'The Competition Bureau invited market participants from June to August 2025 to provide input on algorithmic pricing and its impact on competition.', 'In January 2025, the Competition Bureau issued a report summarizing feedback on artificial intelligence and competition following its consultation.', 'The Competition Bureau will continue to closely monitor the rental housing market to respond to developments that could disrupt competition.', 'The Competition Bureau stated that if it finds evidence of anticompetitive conduct it will take appropriate action to maintain fair competition in the rental housing market.']
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Incident Investigation; Post-Deployment Monitoring; Governance Disclosure; Risk Management

mitigation_taken: ['The Lafourche Parish School Board held a hearing on Nov. 5 to decide whether to uphold the school district’s decision to expel the child.', 'School board members voted to allow the girl to return to school.', "The school board upheld the student's expulsion.", 'The student was placed on a 90-day probationary period during which she is not allowed to participate in extracurricular activities.', 'The school board passed the investigation to the Lafourche Parish Sheriff’s Office.', 'The Lafourche Parish Sheriff’s Office opened an ongoing investigation into the matter.', 'The Lafourche Parish Sheriff’s Office charged one person in connection with the case.', 'The sheriff’s department stated it would not disclose any further information about the case due to it involving juveniles.', 'Louisiana State Rep. Bryan Fontenot said he is crafting legislation as a direct result of this situation.']

mitigation_taken: ['The researchers ran controlled tests of everyday scenarios to evaluate how LLM-driven robots behave when given harmful or sensitive prompts.', "The authors published their paper 'LLM-Driven Robots Risk Enacting Discrimination, Violence, and Unlawful Actions' in the International Journal of Social Robotics.", 'The paper called for the immediate implementation of robust, independent safety certification for AI-driven robots, similar to standards in aviation or medicine.', 'The researchers highlighted the urgent need for routine and comprehensive risk assessments of AI before deployment in robots.', "The research team made their code and an evaluation framework for assessing discrimination risks of LLMs available on the project's website."]

mitigation_taken: ["The UK Department for Transport and the National Cyber Security Centre opened an investigation into whether Yutong can update software to remotely access its vehicles' control systems.", 'The UK Department for Transport stated it is working closely with the NCSC to understand the technical basis of the actions taken by Norwegian and Danish authorities.', 'Norwegian authorities launched an investigation into Yutong buses and found the buses could be remotely stopped or rendered unable to start.', 'The Danish government launched an investigation into whether Chinese-built electric buses could be remotely stopped.', "Denmark's investigation evaluated removing SIM cards as a way to prevent remote stopping and decided against removing them because that would disconnect buses from other systems.", "Oslo public transport company Ruter tested Yutong and VDL buses and reported that Yutong had remotely accessed its buses' battery and power management systems.", "Denmark's largest public transport company Movia opened an investigation into the risk and stated that the security concern is not unique to Chinese buses.", 'The U.S. Department of Commerce banned the import and sale of Chinese-made connected cars and related hardware and software citing excessive and unacceptable risks to U.S. national security, with the software ban effective for 2027 model years and the hardware ban effective for 2030 model years.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Interactive Advertising Bureau Spain (IAB) published a study showing that AI-generated videos are the most viewed content on social platforms, especially among young people.', 'The Ministry of Inclusion, Social Security and Migrations published the 2024 Monitoring Report on Hate Speech on Social Networks.', 'Media Matters for America published a study warning that social networks are saturated with hate speech and that algorithms often favor its dissemination.', 'The Universitat Oberta de Catalunya (UOC) conducted research detailing how mental images are manipulable and can be used to reinforce false narratives.', 'Members of the International Fact-Checking Network (IFCN), including Verificat, have repeatedly debunked false narratives about migrant registration (empadronamiento).', 'Verificat debunked the widely circulated claims about people supposedly trapped in the Aldaia shopping center parking after the DANA.', 'Desfake published educational capsules such as "De los prejuicios al odio" and "El poder de la imagen" to help users understand how images and digital content can reinforce stereotypes and to build critical digital literacy.']

mitigation_taken: ['The three victims filed a complaint that initiated the investigation.', 'The suspect was captured by police on September 23.', 'The suspect was detained following his capture.', 'A formalization hearing was held on October 28.', 'The Federal Court of Jujuy accepted the charges and indicted the suspect.', "At the prosecution's request, the court ordered the suspect's preventive detention.", 'The investigation was assigned to the head of the Complex Cases Investigation Area, federal prosecutor Federico Zurueta, and assistant prosecutor Romina Verdur.', 'The victims reported the discovery to police officers stationed at the event.', 'Police recovered the hidden camera after the suspect threw it from a patrol vehicle.', 'The three women were placed under protective custody.', 'Law enforcement seized electronic devices including cell phones, USB drives, external hard drives, a computer, and a tablet.', 'A preliminary forensic examination was conducted on the seized electronic devices.', 'The preliminary forensic examination revealed 15 videos and 68 photos of the three victims and indicated material involving other victims and child sexual abuse.', 'Complementary forensic examinations were requested to determine whether the material was possessed or produced by the suspect.']

mitigation_taken: ['YouTube changed its policy in July to tighten rules defining "authentic" content and to prohibit the monetization of videos the platform deems mass-produced or repetitive.', 'YouTube took down a Canadian Reporter channel with more than 60,000 subscribers in mid-October.', 'YouTube terminated both Canadian Reporter channels under its policies against spam, deceptive practices and scams.', 'YouTube terminated the Canadian Zone channel under its policies against spam, deceptive practices and scams.', 'YouTube terminated the Effect Reporter channel under its policies against spam, deceptive practices and scams.', 'The Canadian Reporter channel with more than 60,000 subscribers was later back up on YouTube and continued to post videos about western separation.', 'YouTube said it reviews all flagged content quickly and removes videos that violate its guidelines.', 'YouTube said it has a team dedicated to identifying and removing spam from YouTube.', 'YouTube said it counts on community members to know the community guidelines and to flag content they believe violates them.', 'Zone Media said videos on Western separation were removed after a routine content review to streamline its content library to focus on more current and relevant topics.', 'The Canadian Reporter included a disclaimer in its channel description stating the videos might explore "unverified information" and should not be interpreted as confirmed facts.']

mitigation_taken: ['Performed technical forensic analysis which showed the video was not real.', 'Urged the public to pause for a few seconds and not immediately believe or reshare emotional videos.', 'Advised people to check the source and determine where and by whom the video or image was first published.', 'Recommended using verification tools such as Google Lens, TinEye, or InVID to search for the original source and verify images or videos.', 'Advised examining lip and facial movements for mismatches and checking for unnatural eye and facial motions as indicators of digital manipulation.', 'Advised inspecting lighting and shadows for inconsistencies with the environment to detect fabricated content.', 'Advised examining strange details such as hands, fingers, or background objects for errors that indicate manipulation.', 'Advised managing strong emotional reactions and being cautious when content provokes immediate anger, shock, or intense feelings.', 'Recommended increasing media literacy and strengthening critical thinking in society as an effective response to such disinformation operations.']
assigned_subcategories: Incident Investigation; Training & Supportive Measures

mitigation_taken: ['The draft law prohibits exploiting images, reputation, influence, or offensive behavior to promote, solicit sales, provide services, or spread disguised e-commerce content.', 'The draft law requires social media platforms operating e-commerce (such as TikTok, Facebook, and YouTube) to warn and remove content that contains disguised commercial elements or is provocative/offensive, especially when the livestreamer has a large following or the audience includes adolescents.', 'The draft law assigns responsibilities to platform owners, sellers, livestreamers, organizations providing affiliate marketing services, and affiliate marketers for commercial activities on their platforms.', 'The draft law makes sellers primarily responsible for the quality and origin of goods.', 'The draft law makes livestreamers responsible for the content and claims they assert or advertise during livestreams.', 'The draft law makes affiliate marketers responsible within the scope they can control and avoids imposing obligations beyond their capacity or the nature of their work.', 'The draft law holds platforms responsible if they fail to implement required technical measures, while clarifying that platforms are not to act as pre-screening advertising approval authorities.', 'The draft law proposes requiring sellers or livestreamers to provide product dossiers to e-commerce platforms for review before live advertising of products that may affect health, such as functional foods and cosmetics.', 'The draft law proposes clarifying the joint liability of livestreamers when they provide information that exceeds or deviates from the product dossier provided by the seller and adding supplementary sanctions such as temporarily banning them from livestreaming.', "The draft law proposes that platforms must publish criteria for livestream display, control fake 'seeding' comments, and implement mechanisms to alert when detecting abnormal interaction volumes."]
assigned_subcategories: Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Content Safety Controls; System & Feature Restrictions; Usage & Access Limitations; Governance Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ["Beeline's anti-fraud platform blocked about 646 million potentially harmful calls between January and October 2025.", 'The anti-fraud platform filters suspicious calls and redirects them to a virtual assistant.', 'A spam robot engages suspicious callers for a while, causing them to realize they are speaking with a bot and hang up.', "Beeline is testing an AI product called 'Кибербабушка' (Cyberbabka) that communicates with fraudsters posing as elderly clients to distract them and consume their resources.", "During testing, Beeline is analyzing scammers' reactions to the AI interactions.", 'Beeline is conducting additional training (fine-tuning) of the AI model based on test results.', 'After launch, unwanted calls directed at elderly customers will be redirected to the AI model that imitates live conversation.', 'In the first quarter of 2026, additional characters and voices will be added to the Cyberbabka product.', "By the second quarter of 2026, the solution will be scaled across Beeline's entire network.", "Beeline's Center of Competence for AI plans to replace third-party technological components with its own solutions.", 'Beeline plans to scale the model within its network so it can simultaneously converse with any number of fraudsters.', "The solution will be made available to all users of the 'My Security' service under the free basic tariff."]
assigned_subcategories: Denial & Defensive Based Actions; Testing & Auditing; Model Safety Engineering; Staged Deployment; Third-Party System Access

mitigation_taken: ['McAfee published a report documenting how widely fake celebrity or influencer endorsements are being used in online scams.', 'The estate of Martin Luther King Jr. reached out to OpenAI to report and express concern about a flood of inappropriate and racist AI videos of King on the platform.', 'OpenAI stated that it plans to work with actors and celebrities to address misuse of AI-generated likenesses.', 'AI companies have implemented systems intended to prevent people from creating AI content of celebrities without their consent.', 'Many AI image and video generators automatically add a clear or embedded watermark to denote content is AI-generated.', 'Platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube label posts as AI-generated when applicable.', 'Inspect videos or images closely for disappearing and reappearing objects as a sign of AI manipulation.', 'Inspect videos or images to see whether they obey the laws of physics as a sign of AI manipulation.', 'Inspect videos or images for a weirdly shiny, plastic-like appearance as a sign of AI manipulation.', 'Check for a visible or embedded watermark indicating AI generation.', 'Verify whether Instagram, TikTok, or YouTube has labeled the post as AI-generated before trusting it.', 'Think before you click to avoid falling for urgency or emotional pressure used in scams.', 'Check the source by confirming whether links are misspelled or deformed.', 'Check whether the official celebrity account has posted about the product before interacting with the post.', 'Confirm whether the account posting the content is verified before trusting endorsements.', 'Be suspicious of sites that request payment through cryptocurrency, Venmo, or other unauthorized payment methods.', 'Be vigilant about sharing personal information to reduce the risk of falling victim to scams.']
assigned_subcategories: Content Safety Controls; Incident Reporting; Training & Supportive Measures; Risk Disclosure

mitigation_taken: ['U.S. PIRG conducted a study examining four AI-enabled toys and reported serious safety issues.', 'U.S. PIRG called for stricter oversight of AI-enabled toys.', 'U.S. PIRG called for better testing of AI conversation modules.', 'U.S. PIRG called for mandatory parental consent for voice and facial capture by AI toys.', 'U.S. PIRG called for clearer standards defining what ‘safe for kids’ means in AI toys.', 'Parents should ensure any AI toy considered has transparent data practices, including disclosure of whether it records or recognizes faces.', 'Parents should ensure they can delete recordings made by the toy.', "Parents should ensure they can disable a toy's voice-listening feature.", 'Parents should check content filters to verify toys do not discuss sexual content, matches, or knives.', 'Parents should prioritize models that allow pausing the chatbot function.', 'Parents should prioritize models that allow limiting play time.', 'Parents should prioritize models that allow disabling the chatbot function entirely.', "Consumers should keep tabs on gift-season launches and watch for labels like 'AI chatbot included'.", 'Consumers should ask retailers directly about what filters, privacy safeguards, and parental controls are built into AI toys.']
assigned_subcategories: Testing & Auditing; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Data Governance; User Rights & Recourse; System & Feature Restrictions

mitigation_taken: ['Ukraine launched serial production of the Octopus interceptor drone.', 'Three manufacturers received the necessary technologies to produce Octopus drones.', 'Eleven additional manufacturers are preparing production lines to produce Octopus drones.', 'The launch of serial production will enable rapid deployment of Octopus interceptor drones to protect Ukrainian airspace from Russian strike drones.', 'The Ministry of Defense continued implementing an open-collaboration policy with Ukrainian manufacturers to expedite the transition from innovation to serial combat solutions.', 'Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal promised to soon reach a production rate of 1,000 interceptor drones per day.', 'Ukraine and the United Kingdom are jointly producing the Octopus drone.', 'Ukraine and the United States have begun producing interceptor drones capable of countering Russian strike drones.', 'The Octopus system became the basis for an international industrial program for mass production.']

mitigation_taken: ['Conducted a one-year concentrated crackdown on cyber sexual violence across jurisdictions.', 'Arrested 3,557 suspects in connection with cyber sexual violence during the crackdown.', 'Detained 221 suspects on charges related to cyber sexual violence.', 'Conducted 256 undercover (decoy) investigations to detect and apprehend offenders.', 'Arrested 913 suspects and detained 36 suspects as a result of undercover investigations.', 'Established and strengthened international cooperation mechanisms with Telegram and other platforms.', 'Utilized deepfake detection software to identify and increase the number of arrests.', 'Requested the deletion and blocking of 36,135 victim video files from the Broadcasting Media Communications Review Committee to prevent secondary harm.', 'Referred 28,356 victims to the Digital Sex Crime Victim Support Center for assistance.', 'Extended the concentrated cyber sexual violence crackdown through October 31 of the following year.', 'Committed to prioritize detection and apprehension of new crimes abusing deepfake, generative AI, and derivative technologies.', 'Planned collaboration with the Ministry of Education to share deepfake crime prevention educational materials and strengthen prevention activities.', 'Carried out the concentrated crackdown centered on dedicated investigative teams within provincial police departments.']

mitigation_taken: ['Tesla confirmed the Optimus production shortfall during a financial earnings telephone conference.', 'Elon Musk announced that Tesla will launch Optimus V3 in Q1 next year and begin mass production by the end of next year.', "Some companies, including Yunshu, sought external partners to make up for deficiencies in AI and the robot 'brain'.", 'Domestic firms and emerging data providers adopted lightweight data collection methods to reduce the cost of training data.', 'Upstream companies provided simulation-to-reality transfer data collection methods by generating training data in simulation and applying techniques such as contrastive learning for reality transfer.', 'Internet consumer companies invested in humanoid-robot firms (for example, Alibaba invested in Yunshu and Xinghaitu, JD invested in Zhiyuan and Zhongqing, and Meituan made similar investments) to provide experimental and training scenarios.', 'Domestic humanoid-robot manufacturers increasingly chose to cooperate with mature suppliers with cross-domain technical accumulation to prioritize reliability and consistency.', 'Some domestic companies fully utilized the domestic supply chain and selected the most appropriate, cost-optimal solution at each stage to achieve better cost control and commercial viability.', 'XPeng transferred precision manufacturing and management capabilities from its automotive operations into its robotics research and development.', 'The industry experienced intensified financing and IPO activity, with over 140 financing events and nearly 20 billion yuan in funding in the first half of the year.']

mitigation_taken: ['The Princeton team developed a "bullshit index" to measure and compare an AI model's internal confidence in a statement with what it actually tells users.', 'The researchers identified five distinct forms of truth-indifferent behavior exhibited by LLMs: empty rhetoric, weasel words, paltering, unverified claims, and sycophancy.', 'They developed a new training method called "Reinforcement Learning from Hindsight Simulation" that evaluates AI responses based on their long-term outcomes rather than immediate user satisfaction.', 'As part of that method, the team used additional AI models to simulate likely future outcomes in order to assess the potential consequences of AI advice.']

mitigation_taken: ['The U.S. Army has been put in charge of the counter-drone threat for the Pentagon.', 'The Army is working hand in glove with law enforcement agencies.', 'The Army is working with law enforcement agencies at borders and ports.', 'The Army is working with law enforcement agencies at major events such as upcoming NFL games, the Olympics, and the World Cup.', 'The U.S. government is designing a system to know what is in the sky at every moment across the country.', 'They are designing a system to allow Americans to fly drones.', 'The government is working with the Federal Aviation Administration to deconflict the skies.', 'The Army and government are welcoming in American industry to help address the drone problem.', 'The U.S. Army is going to invest in sensors, brushless motors, circuit boards, and other drone components.', 'The United States Army will build those components on its bases.', 'The Army will empower the private sector to purchase components from the Army.', 'The Army will manufacture drones itself.', 'Private partners will manufacture drones in partnership with the Army.']

mitigation_taken: ['Australia’s National Anti-Scam Centre is investigating the website operation.', 'The Guardian contacted Melbourne Book Publisher and First Page Press with questions about their use of AI-generated content.', 'Both Melbourne Book Publisher and First Page Press pulled down parts of their websites, including AI-generated staff images, after the Guardian contacted them.', 'Nick Courtright, CEO of Atmosphere Press, issued a cease and desist notice to First Page Press.', 'Nick Courtright reported the matter to Scamwatch.', "David Tenenbaum posted a public warning about the impostor Melbourne Book Publisher on his company's website.", 'Andrea contacted her bank to retrieve the $88 she had paid.', 'David Tenenbaum personally called the number listed on Melbourne Book Publisher’s Facebook page posing as a first-time author to investigate the operation.', 'Blair N Williamson and Katrina Germein sent cease and desist notifications to Aussie Book Publisher seeking responses.', 'Blair N Williamson and Katrina Germein reported Aussie Book Publisher to Scamwatch.', 'Melbourne Book Publisher said it would offer a formal apology to Melbourne Books and Andrea.', 'Melbourne Book Publisher stated that the person who made the legal threats was an employee who no longer worked for the company.', 'The Guardian uncovered similar suspicious websites operating in the UK, New Zealand, and additional sites in Australia.', 'The ACCC said the National Anti-Scam Centre is looking into the matter and encouraged people who encounter publishing scams to report them to Scamwatch.']

mitigation_taken: ['Job seekers use tools like ChatGPT to help with resumes and cover letters.', 'Seventy percent of job seekers reject one-way AI interviews.', 'Treat AI as an editor or thought consultant rather than as a ghostwriter.', 'Use AI to generate bullet points for resumes.', 'Use AI to identify keywords from job descriptions.', 'Use AI to reformat resumes for clarity.', 'Manually infuse resumes and cover letters with your accomplishments and personal voice after using AI.', 'Use AI to tighten language and check for clarity.', 'Ensure the content and the explanation of achievements come from your own experience rather than from AI.', 'Spend 15 minutes cleaning your CV.', 'Spend seven hours and 45 minutes researching the company and the hiring manager.', 'Map the hiring team when preparing applications.', 'Create a short teardown to present to decision-makers.', 'Create a repository (repo) of work to showcase to employers.', 'Create a one-page document with ideas tailored to the company.', 'Get your materials into the hands of actual people through informational interviews.', 'Obtain referrals to get your application noticed by hiring managers.', 'Conduct direct outreach to hiring managers or decision-makers.', 'Post openly on LinkedIn using storytelling to build a personal brand.', 'Clarify your target roles as part of focusing on micro wins.', 'Schedule networking calls as part of building momentum in the job search.', 'Improve application materials as part of a strategy of celebrating micro wins.', 'Tailor resumes for each job application to increase interview opportunities.', 'Connect directly with people in your network rather than relying solely on automated application processes.']

mitigation_taken: ['A technology expert issued a warning that ultra-realistic AI video tools on platforms like Sora 2 are being exploited by scammers.', 'Outplayed technology experts released guidance advising people to look for reduced blinking or robotic eye movements as a sign of AI-generated video.', 'Outplayed experts advised checking for deformed or fused fingers and unnatural hand movements as indicators of AI-generated video.', 'Outplayed experts warned to look for lighting errors such as shadows falling in odd directions or faces appearing overly bright as signs of AI-generated video.', "Outplayed experts advised examining water and reflections for liquid that appears unnaturally still or 'too perfect' as a sign of AI-generated video.", "Outplayed experts warned to look for lip-sync problems, especially mismatches on sounds like 'p' or 'b', indicate AI-generated video.", 'Outplayed experts advised that overly smooth, plastic-like skin with no pores or texture is a sign of AI-generated video.', 'Outplayed experts recommended watching for background errors such as deformed objects or flickering edges as indicators of AI-generated video.', 'Outplayed experts advised looking for rigid or unnatural movement of clothing in wind as a sign of AI-generated video.', "Outplayed experts warned to watch for awkward scene transitions like jumps or clumsy 'blinks' mid-frame that suggest video editing by AI.", 'Outplayed experts advised checking for odd context, such as people appearing out of place, as an indicator that a video may be AI-generated.', 'Outplayed experts suggested that if a video simply feels strange, that intuition should be taken as a sign it may be AI-generated.']

mitigation_taken: ["Judge Victoria Kolakowski dismissed the case Mendones v. Cushman & Wakefield on Sept. 9, citing the plaintiffs' use of AI-generated material masquerading as real evidence.", "Judge Kolakowski denied the plaintiffs' request for reconsideration on Nov. 6.", 'The National Center for State Courts and the Thomson Reuters Institute created resources to help judges address deepfakes.', "The consortium labeled deepfakes as 'unacknowledged AI evidence' to distinguish them from 'acknowledged AI evidence.'", 'The consortium published a cheat sheet to help judges deal with deepfakes.', 'The cheat sheet advises judges to ask those providing potentially AI-generated evidence to explain its origin.', 'The cheat sheet advises judges to ask who had access to the evidence.', 'The cheat sheet advises judges to ask whether the evidence had been altered in any way.', 'The cheat sheet advises judges to look for corroborating evidence.', "A Washington state judge in April 2024 denied a defendant's effort to use an AI tool to clarify a submitted video.", 'Minnesota Judge Stoney Hiljus is surveying state judges in Minnesota to better understand how generative AI is showing up in their courtrooms.', 'Several judges and legal experts advocated for changes to judicial rules and guidelines on how attorneys verify their evidence.', 'Maura R. Grossman and Paul Grimm proposed a rule requiring parties alleging that the opposition used deepfakes to thoroughly substantiate their arguments.', 'Grossman and Grimm proposed transferring the duty of deepfake identification from juries to judges.', 'The U.S. Judicial Conference’s Advisory Committee on Evidence Rules considered those proposals in May but did not approve them.', "The committee decided to keep a deepfake evidence rule 'in the bullpen' for possible future consideration.", 'The Trump administration released an AI Action Plan in July that highlights the need to combat synthetic media in the court system and advocates exploring deepfake-specific standards.', "Louisiana passed Act 250 requiring attorneys to exercise 'reasonable diligence' to determine if evidence they or their clients submit has been generated by AI.", "In the Mendones case, the court examined the video's metadata and used it to determine the video could not have been recorded on the device claimed by the plaintiffs."]
assigned_subcategories: Training & Supportive Measures; Incident Investigation; Regulatory, Policy & Legal Mandates; Court & Law Enforcement Interventions; System Documentation
